基尔比特别强调的一件事是，他不应该被当作特殊人物对待。当堪萨斯州的一位学校董事会成员提议将大本德高中的名字改为杰克·S·基尔比高中时，学校最杰出的校友立即否决了这个想法。“当他们与道奇城队踢足球时，他们不想被称为‘基尔比’，”杰克说。“他们必须被称为‘大本德’。无论如何，整个事情都会很麻烦。我不值得这么大惊小怪。”

One thing that Kilby particularly insists is that he not be treated as somebody special. When a school board member back in Kansas proposed changing the name of Great Bend High School to Jack S. Kilby High, the school’s most distinguished alumnus immediately scotched the idea. “When they play football against Dodge City, they don’t want to be ‘Kilby,’” Jack said. “They’ve got to be ‘Great Bend.’ Anyway, the whole thing would be a lot of trouble. I’m not worth the fuss.”

然而，在 2000 年秋天，杰克·基尔比发现自己陷入了一场大混乱之中。10 月 10 日黎明前，欧洲的记者开始疯狂地给达拉斯的“J. 基尔比”打电话。杰克确实有一个电话号码，但他在电话簿上的名字是 JS 基尔比。接电话的 J. 基尔比是他的妹妹简。“当第一个人说‘诺贝尔奖’这个词时，我就知道这一天会很忙，”简后来说道。她跑到哥哥家，发现门廊上挤满了记者，他们徒劳地敲着一个晚上摘下助听器的男人的前门。最后，杰克穿着绿色长袍来到门口，向瑞典皇家科学院表示感谢。然后他回到厨房吃早餐。

In the fall of the year 2000, though, Jack Kilby found himself at the center of an enormous fuss. In the predawn hours of October 10, reporters in Europe started placing frantic calls to “J. Kilby” in Dallas. Jack does, in fact, have a listed telephone number, but he’s in the directory as J. S. Kilby. The J. Kilby who received those calls was his sister Jane. “As soon as the first fellow said the words ‘Nobel Prize,’ I knew it was going to be a busy day,” Jane said later. She raced over to her brother’s house and found a cluster of reporters on the porch, banging fruitlessly on the front door of a man who had removed his hearing aid for the night. Eventually, Jack came to the door in a green robe and expressed gratitude to the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences. Then he headed back to the kitchen for breakfast.

但很明显，杰克·基尔比在聚光灯之外所珍视的生活将要改变，至少暂时如此。作为科学界历史最悠久、奖金最丰厚、最负盛名的荣誉，诺贝尔奖是全球奖项中的重头戏，是终极荣誉。当基尔比获得京都先进技术奖、美国机械工程师学会霍利奖章或电气电子工程师学会荣誉勋章时，媒体可能会视而不见。但诺贝尔奖不容忽视。

But it was evident that Jack Kilby’s cherished life outside the spotlight was going to change, at least for a while. As the oldest, richest, and most prestigious honor in science, the Nobel Prize is the big enchilada of global awards, the ultimate accolade. The media might have looked the other way when Kilby won the Kyoto Prize in Advanced Technology or the Holley Medal of the American Society of Mechanical Engineers or the Institute of Electrical and Electronic Engineers Medal of Honor. But the Nobel Prize was not to be ignored.

十几年前，当集成电路已经明显具有历史意义时，我曾问过杰克·基尔比和罗伯特·诺伊斯，为什么他们的发明没有为他们赢得诺贝尔奖。两人都给出了相同的答案：单片机的想法不是赢得诺贝尔奖的东西。诺伊斯回答说：“基本上，我们关注的是工程发展。”他表示很荣幸被问到这个问题。“如果你看看诺贝尔奖，它颁发给科学界的重要发现。”也许如此，我反驳道，但晶体管在发明仅仅九年后就获得了诺贝尔奖。微芯片已经有三十年的历史了——斯德哥尔摩对此只字未提。“但那不一样，”诺伊斯用耐心老师的语气说道。“1956 年的奖项不是颁发给设备的发明者。而是颁发给晶体管效应的物理学。”

A dozen years earlier, when it was already clear that the integrated circuit was a development of historic dimensions, I had asked both Jack Kilby and Robert Noyce why their invention hadn’t won them a Nobel Prize in something. Both men gave the same answer: The monolithic idea wasn’t the type of thing that won Nobel Prizes. “Basically, we’re looking at an engineering development,” Noyce replied, after noting that he was flattered to be asked. “If you look at the Nobel Prize, it goes to important discoveries in science.” Maybe so, I shot back, but the transistor won a Nobel Prize, just nine years after it was invented. The microchip was already thirty years old—and nary a word from Stockholm. “But that’s different,” Noyce said, in the tones of a patient teacher. “The 1956 prize was not awarded for the invention of the device. It was for the physics of the transistor effect.”

事实上，瑞典皇家科学院的科学奖项过于深奥，遭到了不少批评，而它未能承认微芯片就是批评者们的典型例证。当然，诺贝尔物理学奖和化学奖得主因重大发现而获奖，但这些发现往往只对该领域一小部分专家有意义。诺贝尔委员会尊重学术而忽视实践，可以说是轻视了真正做出贡献的人的工作——也挫败了阿尔弗雷德·诺贝尔的计划，他明确表示，他的奖项旨在奖励“那些……为人类带来最大利益的人”。在二十世纪下半叶，没有任何科学发展比芯片带来更大的利益——但芯片的发明者却没有获得诺贝尔奖。委员会在三十多年里一直忽视微芯片的发明者，完全拒绝将奖项颁给罗伯特·诺伊斯。当诺贝尔奖的评委们将诺伊斯授予集成电路时，他已经去世了，而诺贝尔奖并不是追授给死者的。《华尔街日报》从中看出欧洲左翼人士企图阻挠诺伊斯获得应有的回报：“为什么？因为他是商人，他的工作具有商业性。瑞典文学院永远不会容忍一个肮脏的资本家，尤其是非常富有的资本家，获得诺贝尔奖。”

Actually, there has been considerable criticism of the Royal Swedish Academy for the excessively esoteric nature of its science prizes, and its failure to recognize the microchip was Exhibit A for the critics. Nobel laureates in physics and chemistry win the award for important discoveries, of course, but often the discoveries are important only to a small clique of specialists in a subset of the field. By honoring the academic and ignoring the practical, the Nobel Committee was arguably slighting the work of people who made genuine contributions—and frustrating the design of Alfred Nobel, who stated explicitly that his award was intended for “those who . . . shall have conferred the greatest benefit on mankind.” In the last half of the twentieth century, there was no scientific development that conferred greater benefits than the chip—but there was no Nobel for the chip’s inventors. By ignoring, for more than three decades, the inventors of the microchip, the committee denied the prize completely to Robert Noyce. Noyce was dead by the time the Nobel people honored the integrated circuit, and Nobel Prizes are not awarded posthumously. The Wall Street Journal spotted in this a plot by European left-wingers to thwart Noyce’s legitimate deserts: “Why? Because he was a businessman and because his work had been commercial. The Swedish Academy would never stand for a dirty capitalist, especially a very, very rich one, getting the prize.”

然而，对于新世纪的首个奖项，诺贝尔委员会采取了彻底的实用主义立场。10 月 10 日，瑞典皇家科学院正式宣布，2000 年诺贝尔物理学奖承认了物理学与计算机和电信信息时代的联系。因此，物理学奖被分成两半。一半奖金将授予杰克·S·基尔比，“表彰他在集成电路发明中所发挥的作用”。另一半奖金将由两位物理学家分享，他们是俄罗斯约飞物理技术研究所的 Zhores I. Alferov 和加州大学圣巴巴拉分校的 Herbert Kroemer，“表彰他们在高速和光电子领域所用的半导体异质结构方面的贡献”。从本质上讲，Alferov 和 Kroemer 对杰克的基本思想做出了有价值的改进。“异质结构”一词指的是由不同半导体交替层组成的芯片。 Alferov 和 Kroemer 各自独立确定了异质结构如何用于产生激光束（例如 CD 播放器的读写头中的激光束）以及使手机工作所需的微型但功能强大的放大器。该学院的声明承认“集成电路更多的是一项技术发明，而不是物理学发现。”但这没关系，因为“很明显它涉及许多物理问题……[例如]如何生产只有几个原子厚的致密层。”

For its first award of the new century, however, the Nobel Committee adopted a thoroughly practical stance. The official announcement that went out from the Royal Swedish Academy on October 10 explained that the Nobel Prize in Physics for 2000 recognized the connection between physics and the information age of computers and telecommunications. Accordingly, the physics prize was split. Half would go to Jack S. Kilby “for his part in the invention of the integrated circuit.” The other half of the prize money was to be divided between two academic physicists, Zhores I. Alferov of Russia’s Ioffe Physico-Technical Institute, and Herbert Kroemer, of the University of California at Santa Barbara, “for developing semiconductor heterostructures used in high-speed and opto-electronics.” In essence, Alferov and Kroemer had made valuable improvements on Jack’s basic idea. The term “heterostructure” refers to a chip made up of alternating layers of different semiconductors. Alferov and Kroemer had independently determined how heterostructures could be used to generate a laser beam—such as the one in the read/write head of a CD player—and the tiny but powerful amplifier required to make cellular phones work. The academy’s announcement conceded that “the integrated circuit is more of a technical invention than a discovery in physics.” But that was all right, because “it is evident that it embraces many physical issues . . . [such as] how to produce dense layers that are only a few atoms thick.”

10 月 10 日，德克萨斯州的天气渐渐明朗，人们很快意识到杰克在前廊的短暂露面无法让媒体大军满意。因此，当天晚些时候，这位新近获奖的获奖者被带入德州仪器的会议室，举行正式新闻发布会。杰克首先向罗伯特·诺伊斯致敬：“我很遗憾他已经去世。如果他还活着，我想我们会分享这个奖项。”然后，他回答了无数关于他的发明和他自己的问题，特别是关于他自己的低科技生活方式的问题。“好吧，我可能是房间里唯一一个没有手机的人，”基尔比承认道。和往常一样，他竭尽全力淡化他改变了世界的说法，坚称许多其他工程师也做出了贡献。记者们被这位世界级的超级成就者的低调表现所震撼。“他看起来像每个人的祖父，” 《达拉斯 晨报》评论道， “而不是信息时代的开创者。”

As October 10 dawned over Texas, it quickly became obvious that Jack’s brief appearance on the front porch was not going to satisfy the media hordes. Accordingly, later that day, the newly named laureate was ushered into a conference room at Texas Instruments for a formal press conference. Jack first offered a tribute to Robert Noyce: “I’m sorry he’s not still alive. If he were, I suspect we’d share this prize.” He then answered endless questions about his invention and himself, particularly about his own low-tech lifestyle. “Well, I may be the only person in the room without a cell phone,” Kilby conceded. As always, he did his best to deflate the suggestion that he had changed the world, insisting that many other engineers shared the credit. The reporters were smitten by this understated performance from a world-class overachiever. “He looked like everyone’s grandfather,” observed The Dallas Morning News, “not the man who spawned the Information Age.”

两个月后，这位信息时代的开创者带着孙女、女儿、女婿和妹妹来到斯德哥尔摩，参加一轮盛大的午宴、招待会、皇家接见等活动。“我不值得这么大惊小怪，”杰克又说了一遍，然后钻进了另一辆沃尔沃豪华轿车，参加另一场为他举行的盛会。不过，他似乎很开心。几位老朋友也在场，一起分享这一时刻。本周最感人的时刻之一是在斯德哥尔摩大酒店的大厅里，杰克看到了另一位多年前的熟人：戈登·摩尔。41 年前，当诺伊斯首次提出这个庞大的想法时，他是鲍勃·诺伊斯的工程师和企业家同事，他经常收到诺贝尔奖颁奖典礼的邀请。但现在，他第一次决定参加。“我是为了我的朋友，”摩尔说。 “如果我的同事鲍勃·诺伊斯还活着，他将获得集成电路诺贝尔奖。我想我应该来，这样鲍勃就能在他的发明被表彰时出席。”

Two months later, with granddaughters, daughters, son-in-law, and sister in tow, the man who spawned the information age arrived in Stockholm for a glittering round of luncheons, receptions, royal audiences, and the like. “I’m not worth the fuss,” Jack said again, as he climbed into yet another Volvo limousine for yet another function in his honor. Still, he appeared to be enjoying himself. Several old friends were on hand to share the occasion. One of the more poignant moments of the week came in the lobby of Stockholm’s Grand Hotel, when Jack spotted another acquaintance from years back: Gordon Moore. Bob Noyce’s engineering and entrepreneurial colleague, the man who was on the receiving end when Noyce had first enunciated the monolithic idea forty-one years earlier, routinely received invitations to the Nobel Prize ceremony. But now for the first time he had decided to attend. “I did it for my friend,” Moore said. “The Nobel Prize for the integrated circuit would have been shared by my colleague Bob Noyce if he were alive. I thought I should come so that Bob would have a presence when his invention was honored.”

除了身着白色领带和燕尾服出席奢华的颁奖典礼（颁奖典礼非常豪华，甚至连外面的交通警察都穿着燕尾服，而为随后的宴会准备的纯银餐具从未用于任何其他用途）之外，诺贝尔奖得主在颁奖周期间唯一不可避免的职责就是发表演讲。杰克·基尔比的诺贝尔物理学演讲在斯德哥尔摩大学校园内一间典型的斯堪的纳维亚演讲厅举行，全是金色木材和光滑的现代家具。一位瑞典物理学家向杰克介绍了他，他指出“基尔比博士”的发明引发了全球数字革命，使计算器、计算机、数码相机、心脏起搏器、互联网等成为可能。杰克当然不会对此置之不理。 “每当我听到这种话，”他说道，“就会想起海狸站在胡佛大坝底部时对兔子说的话：‘不，这不是我自己建造的，但它是基于我的想法。’”大家都喜欢这个笑话，于是杰克赶紧补充说，这个故事是借用了 1964 年获得物理学奖的美国人查尔斯·H·汤斯 (Charles H. Townes) 的话。

Other than showing up in white tie and tails for the lavish awards ceremonies—the event is so fancy that even the traffic cops outside wear tuxedos, and the sterling silver laid out for the ensuing banquet is never used for any other function—a Nobel laureate’s only unavoidable duty during prize week is to deliver a lecture. Jack Kilby’s Nobel lecture in physics took place in a classically Scandinavian lecture hall, all blond wood and sleek modern furniture, on the campus of Stockholm University. Jack was introduced by a Swedish physicist who noted that “Dr. Kilby’s” invention had launched the global digital revolution, making possible calculators, computers, digital cameras, pacemakers, the Internet, etc., etc. Naturally, Jack wasn’t going to let that go unanswered. “When I hear that kind of thing,” he said, “it reminds me of what the beaver told the rabbit as they stood at the base of Hoover Dam: ‘No, I didn’t build it myself, but it’s based on an idea of mine.’” Everybody liked that joke, so Jack quickly added that he had borrowed the story from Charles H. Townes, an American who won the physics prize in 1964.

随后，基尔比用他那深沉、缓慢的堪萨斯口音描述了数字的暴政以及 20 世纪 50 年代为克服它而做出的各种努力。他描述了他在 TI 想到的解决方案，并解释了鲍勃·诺伊斯不久后的工作如何补充了他的方法。他展示了他最初的相移振荡器的幻灯片，手工雕刻的芯片粘在玻璃实验室幻灯片上，飞线四处伸出。“如果我意识到我必须盯着这个东西看 42 年，我会在它的外观上多花点心思，”他说。杰克对这项发明改变电子学的方式感到惊讶：“过去 42 年的发展速度比威廉·吉尔伯特创造‘电’一词后的前 400 年还要快。”他接着说，芯片的改进，尤其是成本的不断降低，几乎让普通人随处都可以享受高科技奇迹。 “我很高兴能够在将人类的聪明才智和创造力转化为现实的过程中发挥哪怕是很小的作用。”

Kilby then went on, in his deep, slow Kansas drawl, to describe the tyranny of numbers and the various efforts to overcome it in the 1950s. He described the solution he hit upon at TI and explained how Bob Noyce’s work shortly thereafter had complemented his own approach. He showed the slide of his original phase-shift oscillator, with the hand-carved chip glued to a glass laboratory slide and the flying wires sticking out every which way. “Had I realized that I would have to look at that thing for 42 years, I would have put a little more effort into its appearance,” he said. Jack expressed astonishment at the way the invention had changed electronics: “The development in the last 42 years has been more rapid than in the first 400 years after William Gilbert coined the word ‘electricity.’” Improvements in the chip, and particularly the constant cost reduction, had made high-tech wonders available to ordinary people almost everywhere, he went on. “I’m happy to have had even a small part in this process of turning human ingenuity and creativity into practical reality.”

这位制造了微芯片的人以他一贯的谦逊语气走回了自己的座位。结果，他又回到了默默无闻的状态。

On that characteristically humble note, the man who made the microchip strode back to his seat. And, as it turned out, back to obscurity.

颁奖典礼前几周，诺贝尔奖似乎又引发了人们对基尔比、诺伊斯以及更广泛的观念的关注，即这两位发起革命的发明家应该得到同胞的认可和尊重。世纪之交，新千年伊始美国作为世界主要政治、金融和工业强国的地位，导致全国关注美国如何——毕竟一个世纪前美国还只是一个发展中国家——取得了如今的崇高地位。显然，像诺伊斯和基尔比这样的技术专家是答案的关键部分。2000 年的诺贝尔奖似乎强调了这一点。许多美国人感到自豪。德州仪器在 I-635 旁边的那栋大楼上贴了一张巨大的新海报：“杰克制造的芯片获得了诺贝尔奖。”即将离任的总统比尔克林顿邀请杰克基尔比到白宫喝咖啡。新任总统乔治·W·布什欢迎杰克·基尔比加入新成立的德克萨斯科学名人堂，这是他担任德克萨斯州州长期间的最后一次正式活动之一。新闻杂志和有线电视脱口秀节目实际上对集成电路和制造第一块集成电路的人给予了一些关注。《托皮卡灯塔报》将杰克·圣克莱尔·基尔比评为 2000 年“堪萨斯年度人物”。宣布这一选择的头版文章是旧新闻规则“寻找当地视角”的典型范例。回想 1937 年的暴风雪，故事开头是：“60 多年前堪萨斯的一场冰暴推动了一项改变世界的发明。”

For a few weeks, just before that awards ceremony, the Nobel Prize seemed to trigger a new surge of interest in Kilby, in Noyce, and in the broader notion that the two inventors who launched a revolution deserved the recognition and esteem of their countrymen. Something about the turning of the century, about America’s stature as the world’s dominant political, financial, and industrial power at the dawn of a new millennium, led to a national focus on how the United States—which had been, after all, a mere snip of a developing nation one century before—had achieved its exalted status. It was obvious that technologists like Noyce and Kilby were a key part of the answer. And the Nobel Prize in the year 2000 seemed to emphasize the point. Many Americans were proud. Texas Instruments put a huge new poster on that building beside I-635: “The Chip That Jack Built Won the Nobel Prize.” The outgoing president, Bill Clinton, invited Jack Kilby to the White House for coffee. The incoming president, George W. Bush, in one of his last official acts as governor of Texas, welcomed Jack Kilby as a charter inductee into the new Texas Science Hall of Fame. Newsmagazines and cable talk shows actually paid some attention to the integrated circuit and the man who had made the first one. The Topeka Beacon-Journal named Jack St. Clair Kilby its “Kansan of the Year” for 2000. The front-page article announcing the choice was a textbook example of that old journalistic rule, Find the Local Angle. Harking back to the blizzard of ’37, the story began: “A Kansas ice storm more than 60 years ago set the wheels in motion for an invention that would change the world.”

但这种关注并不会持续太久，就像堪萨斯的冰暴一样。当这位新近获奖的诺贝尔奖得主从斯德哥尔摩回到家时，他可以在达拉斯-沃斯堡机场漫步，而没有人会回头。当地福克斯分支机构 KDFW-TV 的记者杰夫·克里利 (Jeff Crilley) 找到了一个巧妙的方式来报道发明该芯片的达拉斯工程师。他带着麦克风来到达拉斯市中心，走近街上的路人。“你有计算器吗？”他会问。“你有手机吗？你家里有电脑吗？”几乎每个人都知道。“你知道杰克·基尔比是谁吗？”没人知道。在华盛顿特区进行的类似实验也得到了同样茫然的表情。即使是在堪萨斯州的大本德，诺贝尔奖的颁发和颁发对当地人对本土爱迪生的了解也几乎没有什么影响。 “如果我到处说‘杰克·基尔比’这个名字，”大本德论坛报 (Great Bend Tribune) 编辑詹妮弗·沙茨 (Jennifer Schartz) 叹息道， “那么，有些人会说，‘哦，和计算机有关吗？’”

But the attention would not last much longer than a Kansas ice storm. By the time the newly honored laureate arrived home from Stockholm, he could stroll through Dallas–Fort Worth Airport without the turn of a single head. Jeff Crilley, a reporter for KDFW-TV, the local Fox affiliate, found a clever way to report on the Dallas engineer who invented the chip. He took a microphone to downtown Dallas and approached passers-by on the street. “Do you have a calculator?” he would ask. “Do you have a cell phone? Do you have a computer at home?” Almost everybody did. “And do you know who Jack Kilby is?” Nobody did. A similar experiment in Washington, D.C., produced the same blank looks. Even in Great Bend, Kansas, of all places, the Nobel Prize came and went with minimal impact on local knowledge about the homegrown Edison. “If I went around town and said the name ‘Jack Kilby,’” sighed Jennifer Schartz, editor of the Great Bend Tribune, “well, a few people would say, ‘Oh, something to do with computers?’”

讽刺的是，我们这个充斥着媒体的社会，对重要人物或至少是有趣人物有着无尽的追求，却不知何故忽视了两位真正的民族英雄——两位美国人，他们提出了改善世界日常生活的好主意。

And there was the central irony. Our media-soaked society, with its insatiable appetite for important, or at least interesting, personalities, has somehow managed to overlook a pair of genuine national heroes—two Americans who had a good idea that has improved the daily lot of the world.

作者注

AUTHOR’S NOTE

这本书始于大约二十年前，当时一台打字机消失了。

This book began, some two decades ago, with a disappearing typewriter.

1980 年 11 月 3 日，也就是罗纳德·里根当选美国总统的前一天，经过一年的总统竞选报道，我回到了《华盛顿邮报》的办公桌前。令我难过的是，我珍爱的老式打字机不见了。

On November 3, 1980—the day before Ronald Reagan was elected president of the United States—I returned to my desk at The Washington Post after a year of constant travel covering the presidential campaign. To my distress, my cherished old typewriter had disappeared.

邮报在原处安装了一台电脑终端；从现在起，我要用它来写故事。起初，我对这个冒牌货很反感，就像数字革命初期大多数新电脑用户一样。但很快，我意识到，我办公桌上的这个笨重的东西比它取代的打字机更快、更安静、更易于使用，而且效率更高。不到两周，我就成了这项新技术的忠实拥护者。

In its place, the Post had installed a computer terminal; from now on, I was to write my stories on that. At first, I resented this impostor, as most new computer users did in those early days of the digital revolution. Quite soon, though, I came to realize that this hulking presence on my desk was faster, quieter, easier to use, and far more efficient than the typewriter it had replaced. Within two weeks, I was a devout convert to the new technology.

有一天，我生气了，就朝机器打了一巴掌。红灯闪烁；蜂鸣器响起；屏幕变黑了。在那些开拓性的岁月里，任何敢于安装大量计算机的公司都必须安排一队技术人员随时看管机器（及其用户）。于是，一名技术人员迅速来到我坏掉的终端机旁，打开了机柜。“我们必须更换一个芯片，”她说。她拿出一个大约半英寸长的黑色小矩形，两边各有一排铜脚——一只塑料甲虫——把它扔到我的手掌里。“这个芯片是整个东西的心脏，”她说。

One day I got mad at something and took a swat at the machine. Red lights blinked; beepers beeped; the screen went dark. In those pioneering days, any company brave enough to install a bunch of computers had to keep a corps of technicians on hand to watch over the machines (and their users). So a technician quickly came over to my broken terminal and opened the cabinet. “We’ll have to replace a chip,” she said. She pulled out a small black rectangle, maybe half an inch long, with a row of copper legs along each side—a plastic beetle—and dropped it into my palm. “This chip is the heart of the whole thing,” she said.

在那之前，我抽象地知道信息时代的基础是一块微型“微芯片”，尽管我不知道这个术语的含义。突然间，这种抽象的认识在我掌中转化为切实的现实。我决心要更多地了解这种芯片及其工作原理。就在那时，我冲到宾夕法尼亚大道上的 Reiter 技术书店，想找一本关于硅芯片的书。售货员给了我一本标准教材—— 《微电子学》，作者是哥伦比亚大学的 Jacob Millman 教授。这是该领域的一本传奇著作，培养了一代电气工程师。但对于非工程师来说，这本书很难读懂；第一章的第一段讨论了非均匀浓度梯度对晶体中电荷传输的影响。但 Millman 教授也意识到他的主题背后有一个伟大的故事，所以他在正文前面加上了“电子学简史”。我在那里找到了以下内容：“1958 年，基尔比 (Kilby) 提出了单片电路理念，即用锗或硅构建整个电路的概念。……大约在同一时间，诺伊斯 (Noyce) ……也有了单片电路理念。”

Up to that moment, I had known in some abstract sense that the information age was based on a tiny “microchip,” although I had no idea what this term might mean. Suddenly that abstract awareness was translated into a tangible reality in the palm of my hand. I was determined to find out more about this chip and how it worked. Right then and there I dashed out to Reiter’s technical bookstore on Pennsylvania Avenue to find a book on silicon chips. The salesman gave me the standard text—Microelectronics, by Professor Jacob Millman of Columbia University. This was a legendary book in its field, having nurtured a generation of electrical engineers. For the non-engineer, though, it was tough going; the first paragraph of the first chapter dealt with the impact of a nonuniform concentration gradient on the transport of charges in a crystal. But Professor Millman also recognized the great story that underlay his topic, so he prefaced his text with “A Brief History of Electronics.” There I found the following: “In 1958 Kilby conceived the Monolithic Idea, that is, the concept of building an entire circuit out of germanium or silicon. . . . About this same time, Noyce . . . also had the monolithic-circuit idea.”

这对我来说犹如晴天霹雳。我第一次意识到一个显而易见的事实：这个神奇的芯片是人造的奇迹。计算机时代的所有奇迹，所有的“电子大脑”和“人工智能”，都只是人类大脑——最强大的智慧的产物。除此之外，我还对一个想法可以有一个名字——“整体想法”——以及两个活着的美国人构想出一个将改变世界的想法的概念非常着迷。

This hit me like a bolt of lightning. For the first time I realized the obvious: This miraculous chip was a man-made miracle. All the marvels of the computer age, all the “electronic brains” and “artificial intelligence,” were simply products of the most powerful intelligence of all—the human brain. Beyond that, I was quite taken with the concept that an idea could have a name—“the monolithic idea”—and that two living Americans had conceived an idea that would change the world.

我决心要见见发明这项技术的人，并了解他们是如何做到的。这本书就是我的成果。第一版问世之时，个人电脑这一新型消费品正将信息时代首次带入数百万家庭和办公室。当时，我觉得我的美国同胞竟然还不知道这两位开启了这个新时代的同胞，这真是一个奇怪的怪癖。至少在我看来，诺伊斯和基尔比很快就会与爱迪生、贝尔和福特一起成为家喻户晓的名字。但事实并非如此。这本书的第二版将故事进行了相当大的扩展，并延续到了新世纪，再次表明这两位男士是值得全世界敬佩和效仿的现代英雄。

I resolved to meet the men responsible for the invention and find out how they had done it. This book is the result. The first edition came out just as a new consumer product, the personal computer, was bringing the information age into millions of homes and offices for the first time. Back then, it seemed to me just a strange quirk that my fellow Americans were not yet aware of the two countrymen who had launched this new era. It seemed perfectly obvious—to me, at least—that Noyce and Kilby would soon be household names along with Edison, Bell, and Ford. That didn’t happen. This second edition of the book, with the story considerably expanded and carried forward to a new century, is another effort to suggest that these two men are modern heroes who should be admired and emulated around the world.

许多人帮助我完成了这本书，对此我深表感谢。我最深切的感谢是 Jack Kilby 和 Robert Noyce，他们慷慨地抽出时间，耐心地回答我提出的愚蠢问题。他们的同事 Willis Adcock、Melvin Sharp、Mac Mims、Jerry Merryman、Norman Neureiter、Dick Perdue、Gordon Moore、Jean Hoerni 和 Roger Borovoy 不辞辛劳地帮助我，德州仪器和英特尔公司的图书管理员也是如此。雅达利公司的 Howard Warshaw 带我参观了芯片的内部。贝尔实验室的 Homer Reid 熟练地指导我了解量子理论和数字电路设计的复杂性。Georgine Neureiter、Tom 和 Janet Cameron、Jane Kilby 和 Ann Kilby 都提供了宝贵的帮助，我想不出除了纯粹的善意之外没有其他原因。

Many people have helped me with this book, and my gratitude is enormous. My deepest thanks go to Jack Kilby and Robert Noyce, who were generous with their time and unfailingly patient with my dumb questions. Their colleagues Willis Adcock, Melvin Sharp, Mac Mims, Jerry Merryman, Norman Neureiter, Dick Perdue, Gordon Moore, Jean Hoerni, and Roger Borovoy went out of their way to help me, as did the librarians at both Texas Instruments and Intel Corp. Howard Warshaw of Atari Corporation took me on a guided tour through the inside of a chip. Homer Reid of Bell Labs steered me expertly through the intricacies of quantum theory and digital circuit design. Georgine Neureiter, Tom and Janet Cameron, Jane Kilby, and Ann Kilby have all offered invaluable aid, for no reason that I can think of other than sheer kindness.

我依靠两个伟大的国家知识收藏机构。国会图书馆的科学阅览室是美国的宝藏；那里知识渊博的工作人员是我研究的支柱。大英图书馆的科学收藏馆慷慨地提供了丰富的材料。普林斯顿大学、乔治城大学和斯坦福大学的图书馆也允许我使用它们的资源。我要感谢丹佛、科罗拉多州、华盛顿特区和伦敦威斯敏斯特区的公共图书馆，特别是科罗拉多州山麓小镇卡斯尔罗克的道格拉斯县图书馆 PS Miller 分馆。克利夫兰电子研究所允许我使用教育材料。丹佛大学物理与工程系的 Elizabeth Tuttle 教授和数学系的 Jeff Singh 提供了宝贵的帮助。

I have relied on two great national collections of knowledge. The Science Reading Room at the Library of Congress is an American treasure; the knowledgeable staff there were the main-stays of my research. The Science Collection of the British Library generously made its copious materials available. The libraries of Princeton, Georgetown, and Stanford Universities also permitted me to use their resources. I owe thanks to the public libraries of Denver, Colorado, Washington, D.C., and the Borough of Westminster in London—and particularly to the P. S. Miller branch of the Douglas County Library in the foothills town of Castle Rock, Colorado. The Cleveland Institute of Electronics allowed me the use of educational materials. Professor Elizabeth Tuttle of the Physics and Engineering Department at the University of Denver and Jeff Singh of the Mathematics Department there provided valuable help.

玛拉莉·施瓦茨是世界上最伟大的研究者和编辑之一，她一次又一次地证明，没有一个事实是她无法发现的。我曾请她追踪眼睑眨动的速度；她转眼间就回来了，并提供了详细的报告。在伦敦，我有幸受益于阿迪·布鲁姆的出色报道天赋。许多美国政府官员，包括商务部的约翰·麦克菲、专利局的艾萨克·弗莱施曼和史密森学会的乌塔·C·默茨巴赫博士，都对我提供了帮助。

Maralee Schwartz, one of the world’s great researchers and editors, demonstrated time and again that no fact was too obscure for her to find. I once asked her to track down the speed at which an eyelid blinks; she was back in the wink of an eye with a detailed report. In London, I was lucky to benefit from the awesome reportorial talent of Adi Bloom. Many U.S. government officials, including John McPhee of the Commerce Department, Isaac Fleischmann of the Patent Office, and Dr. Uta C. Merzbach of the Smithsonian Institution, were helpful along the way.

我在华盛顿的几位同事为本书提供了帮助。迷人的享乐主义者本·布拉德利 (Ben Bradlee) 和开朗的反传统主义者比尔·格雷德 (Bill Greider) 很早就意识到这是一部重要的当代史，我应该继续写下去。尼克·雷曼 (Nick Lemann)、乔尔·加罗 (Joel Garreau) 和玛格丽特·夏皮罗 (Margaret Shapiro) 提供了周到而有用的建议。我非常感谢玛丽·麦格罗里 (Mary McGrory)、帕特里克·格罗斯 (Patrick Gross)、海恩斯·约翰逊 (Haynes Johnson) 和海军上将 HG·里科弗 (HG Rickover)，他们从一开始就意识到这项努力将会成为一件有价值的事情。我感谢鲍勃·施伦 (Bob Shrum) 和威廉·莱希博士 (Dr. William Leahy) 在最后提供的中肯建议。我有幸在同一本书上与两位出色的编辑合作：爱丽丝·梅休 (Alice Mayhew) 和安·戈多夫 (Ann Godoff)。他们弄清楚了这本书应该走向何方，并帮助我实现了目标。亨利·费里斯 (Henry Ferris) 和凯特·尼兹维茨基 (Kate Niedzwiecki) 提供了聪明而耐心的编辑指导。柯林斯有限公司的克里斯托弗·麦克莱霍斯 (Christopher McLehose) 提供了诙谐的建议。我的经纪人，先是 Rhoda Weyr，现在是 Gail Ross，在我需要的时候，他们总会在我身边陪伴着我。

Several of my colleagues in Washington assisted with this book. The charming bon vivant Ben Bradlee and the cheery iconoclast Bill Greider both recognized early on that this was an important piece of contemporary history and that I ought to pursue it. Nick Lemann, Joel Garreau, and Margaret Shapiro provided thoughtful and useful advice. I am indebted to Mary McGrory, Patrick Gross, Haynes Johnson, and Admiral H. G. Rickover for recognizing from the beginning that this effort would turn into something worthwhile. I’m grateful to Bob Shrum and Dr. William Leahy for solid advice at the end. I’ve had the good fortune to work with two wonderful editors on one book: Alice Mayhew and Ann Godoff. They figured out where the book should be heading and helped get me there. Henry Ferris and Kate Niedzwiecki offered smart and patient editorial guidance. Christopher McLehose of Collins, Ltd., provided wry advice. My agents, first Rhoda Weyr and now Gail Ross, were there for me to lean on whenever I needed them.

这本书最初是在 Heathkit H-89 电脑上编写的，该电脑基于一种早期的微处理器 Z-80。在 Windows 出现之前的那些古老时代，H-89 使用了一种现已停用的操作系统 CP/M 和一种现已停用的文字处理程序 Peachtext，这两种程序都运行良好。我在基于英特尔奔腾 III 处理器的惠普 Pavilion PC 上编写了这个新版本。

In its first realization, this book was written on a Heathkit H-89 computer based on an early microprocessor known as the Z-80. In those ancient times before Windows, the H-89 used a now-defunct operating system called CP/M and a now-defunct word processing program called Peachtext, both of which worked pretty well. I wrote this new edition on a Hewlett-Packard Pavilion PC built around Intel’s Pentium III processor.

我的电子学教育和本书第一年的研究得到了艾丽西亚·帕特森基金会的资助。我特别感谢基金会的艾丽斯·阿伦、乔·奥尔布赖特、海伦·库尔森和凯茜·特罗斯特。在我的《华盛顿邮报》职业生涯中，华盛顿邮报公司及其可敬的首席执行官唐·格雷厄姆曾两次给我时间和空间来撰写这本书。

My education in electronics and my first year of research on this book were supported by the Alicia Patterson Foundation. I owe particular thanks to Alice Arlen, Joe Albright, Helen Coulson, and Cathy Trost at the foundation. The Washington Post Company and its estimable chief, Don Graham, gave me the time and space to write the book not once but twice during my Post career.

最后，但最重要的是，玛格丽特·玛丽·麦克马洪 (Margaret Mary McMahon)、麦克马洪·托马斯·荷马·里德 (McMahon Thomas Homer Reid)、奥戈尔曼·凯瑟琳·佩内洛普·里德 (O'Gorman Catherine Penelope Reid) 和艾琳·安德洛玛刻·威廉敏娜·里德 (Erin Andromache Wilhelmina Reid) 以愉快的方式忍受了我和手稿，这项任务比写任何书都艰巨得多。

Last but foremost, Margaret Mary McMahon, McMahon Thomas Homer Reid, O’Gorman Catherine Penelope Reid, and Erin Andromache Wilhelmina Reid put up with me and the manuscript in cheery fashion, a task far more formidable than writing any book.

关于资料来源的说明

A NOTE ABOUT SOURCES

那些想深入了解这个故事中任何事件或人物的读者将大饱眼福。关于数字革命背后的物理学和工程学，有很多精彩的书籍和网站。但是，如果你在书店、图书馆或搜索引擎前停下来，开始浏览，你会发现印刷品或屏幕上的内容比任何人都能读到的要多得多。因此，我编制了以下路线图，以引导您找到我在撰写本文时遇到的一些更好的资料来源。

Readers who plan to dig deeper into any of the events or characters of this story have a treat in store. There are some wonderful books and Web sites about the physics and the engineering behind the digital revolution. However, if you stop by a bookstore, library, or search engine and just start browsing, you’ll find there’s much more in print or on screen than anyone could read. Accordingly, I have compiled the following road map to steer you toward some of the better sources I ran across while writing this one.

瑞典皇家科学院在宣布 Jack Kilby 获得诺贝尔奖时，向比特流中泄露了大量有关“物理和信息技术”的信息。这些信息可在www.nobel.se/physics/laureates/2000/illpres/kilby/html找到。相关来源是一个名为“诺贝尔奖互联网档案”的优秀网站，网址为www.almaz.com/nobel/nobel.htm。

The Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences loosed a flood of information about “Physics and Information Technology” into the bit stream when it announced Jack Kilby’s Nobel Prize. This can be found at www.nobel.se/physics/laureates/2000/illpres/kilby/html. A related source is an excellent Web site called The Nobel Prize Internet Archive, at www.almaz.com/nobel/nobel.htm.

我发现的关于半导体电子学通史的最好的非技术性书籍（尽管对芯片的发明和发展有些简略）是Ernest Braun 和 Stuart MacDonald 合著的《微型革命》 （英国剑桥：剑桥大学出版社，1983 年）。S. Handel 的《电子革命》（巴尔的摩：企鹅出版社，1979 年）轻松有趣地讨论了从本杰明·富兰克林到晶体管发明的电子学历史。关于数字暴政的基本文本是由创造该术语的人 Jack A. Morton 撰写的《组织创新》（纽约：麦格劳希尔，1971 年）。还有两本昂贵的厚本电子学史专著：《电子学编辑们，创新时代：电子世界，1930-2000》（纽约：麦格劳希尔，1981 年），通过美国人的眼光看待这个故事；以及伊丽莎白·安特比（Elizabeth Antébi）的《电子时代》（纽约：Van Nostrand Reinhold，1982 年），该书从欧洲的角度介绍了同一时期。

The best nontechnical book I found on the general history of semiconductor electronics (although it is somewhat skimpy on the invention and development of the chip) is Revolution in Miniature, by Ernest Braun and Stuart MacDonald (Cambridge, U.K.: Cambridge University Press, 1983). S. Handel, The Electronic Revolution (Baltimore: Penguin, 1979), is an easy and interesting discussion of electronics history from Benjamin Franklin to the invention of the transistor. The basic text on the tyranny of numbers was written by the man who coined that term, Jack A. Morton, Organizing for Innovation (New York: McGraw-Hill, 1971). There are also two big, expensive coffee-table books on the history of electronics: The Editors of Electronics, An Age of Innovation: The World of Electronics, 1930–2000 (New York: McGraw-Hill, 1981), which looks at the story through American eyes; and Elizabeth Antébi, The Electronic Epoch (New York: Van Nostrand Reinhold, 1982), which provides a European view of the same period.

《科学美国人·微电子学》（旧金山：WH Freeman，1977 年）技术性更强，但普通读者仍能读懂，其中包含罗伯特·诺伊斯撰写的关于这次技术革命的概述。在 200 周年之际，IEEE（IEEE 的首字母缩写发音为“I triple E”，代表电气和电子工程师协会）的几本技术期刊对技术历史给予了极大关注。1976 年 7 月版的《 IEEE 电子设备汇刊 》可在大多数大型公共图书馆或研究图书馆查阅，其中包含许多杰出工程师以第一人称叙述的重要发明，包括威廉·肖克利（晶体管）和杰克·基尔比（芯片）。

Somewhat more technical, but still accessible to the lay reader, is Scientific American, Microelectronics (San Francisco: W. H. Freeman, 1977), which includes an overview of this technical revolution written by Robert Noyce. During the bicentennial year, several of the technical journals of the IEEE (the acronym is pronounced “I triple E” and stands for the Institute of Electrical and Electronic Engineers) gave a great deal of attention to technical history. The July 1976 edition of IEEE Transactions on Electron Devices, available at most large public or research libraries, contains first-person accounts of important inventions by many preeminent engineers, including William Shockley (on the transistor) and Jack Kilby (on the chip).

有几部参考书关注本书所涵盖的内容。我逐渐依赖《范·诺斯特兰计算机科学百科全书》（1976 年）和十五卷的《麦格劳-希尔科学技术百科全书》（1982 年）。GWA Dummer 的《电子发明和发现》（纽约：Pergamon，1983 年）列出了一些重要发展。有关个别科学家和工程师的信息，艾萨克·阿西莫夫的《阿西莫夫科学技术传记百科全书》（纽约花园城：Doubleday，1982 年）是一本令人愉快的快速资源。由查尔斯·C·吉利斯皮教授编辑的多卷《科学传记词典》（纽约：Scribner，1970 年）是一部经典的学术著作，提供了数百名科学家和工程师的清晰而全面的传记。

Several reference works focus on the matters covered in this book. I grew to rely on the Van Nostrand Encyclopedia of Computer Science (1976) and the fifteen-volume McGraw-Hill Encyclopedia of Science and Technology (1982). G.W.A. Dummer, Electronic Inventions and Discoveries (New York: Pergamon, 1983), is a listing of important developments. For information on individual scientists and engineers, Isaac Asimov, Asimov’s Biographical Encyclopedia of Science and Technology (Garden City, N.Y.: Doubleday, 1982), is a delightful quick resource. The multivolume Dictionary of Scientific Biography (New York: Scribner, 1970), edited by Professor Charles C. Gillispie, is a classic piece of scholarship that provides clear and comprehensive biographies of hundreds of scientists and engineers.

两本关于托马斯·爱迪生的近期传记，马修·约瑟夫森的《爱迪生》（纽约：麦格劳-希尔出版社，1959 年）和罗伯特·科诺特的《一连串的幸运》（纽约：海景出版社，1979 年），写得很好，细节丰富。关于弗朗西斯·厄普顿与门洛帕克奇才的关系，最好的资料是厄普顿自己的传记《爱迪生的电灯泡》（1881 年）。若想了解 JJ 汤姆森时代英国物理学的有趣历史，可以阅读 JG Crowther 的《卡文迪什实验室 1874-1974》（纽约：科学史出版社，1974 年）。JJ 的儿子、诺贝尔奖获得者乔治·P·汤姆森爵士写了一本引人入胜的回忆录，讲述了他的父亲JJ 汤姆森和他那个时代的卡文迪什实验室（纽约花园城：Doubleday 出版社，1965 年）。不过，关于 JJ Thomson 最令人愉快的信息来源是他 1936 年出版的朴素而有趣的自传《回忆与思考》，该书已由 Arno Press 重印（纽约，1975 年）。

Two fairly recent biographies of Thomas A. Edison, Matthew Josephson, Edison (New York: McGraw-Hill, 1959), and Robert Conot, A Streak of Luck (New York: Seaview, 1979), are well done and rich with detail. The best source on Francis Upton’s relationship with the Wizard of Menlo Park is Upton’s own history, Edison’s Electric Light Bulb (1881). For a pleasant history of physics in England in J. J. Thomson’s time, there is J. G. Crowther, The Cavendish Laboratory 1874–1974 (New York: Science History Publications, 1974). J.J.’s son, the Nobel laureate Sir George P. Thomson, wrote a fascinating memoir of his father, J. J. Thomson and the Cavendish Laboratory in His Day (Garden City, N.Y.: Doubleday, 1965). The most delightful source of information on J. J. Thomson, though, is his modest, intriguing 1936 autobiography, Recollections and Reflections, which has been reprinted by Arno Press (New York, 1975).

约翰·A·弗莱明 (John A. Fleming) 撰写了自己的回忆录《五十年的电学》 (纽约：无线出版社，1921 年)，他的忠实实验室助手 JT 麦格雷戈-莫里斯 (JT McGregor-Morris) 也撰写了一篇简短的回忆录《阀门的发明者》 (伦敦：电视协会，1954 年)。乔治特·卡内尔 (Georgette Carneal) 的《太空征服者》 (纽约：H. Liveright，1930 年) 是李·德福雷斯特的授权传记。然而，二十年后，这位发明家出版了自传，第二章提到了这个不谦虚的标题：《无线电之父李·德福雷斯特》(芝加哥：Wilcox & Follett，1950 年)。CP·斯诺 (CP Snow) 的《物理学家》(波士顿：Little, Brown，1981 年) 包含对尼尔斯·玻尔的热情描绘。

John A. Fleming wrote a memoir of his own, Fifty Years of Electricity (New York: Wireless Press, 1921), and there is also a short remembrance by his devoted lab assistant, J. T. McGregor-Morris, The Inventor of the Valve (London: The Television Society, 1954). Georgette Carneal’s A Conqueror of Space (New York: H. Liveright, 1930) was an authorized biography of Lee De Forest. Twenty years later, though, the inventor produced the autobiography with the immodest title mentioned in Chapter 2: Lee De Forest, Father of Radio (Chicago: Wilcox & Follett, 1950). C. P. Snow’s The Physicists (Boston: Little, Brown, 1981) contains a warm portrait of Niels Bohr.

威廉·肖克利的权威著作《半导体中的电子和空穴及其在晶体管电子学中的应用》（纽约：范诺斯特兰出版社，1950 年）是有关半导体物理学和肖克利思维方式的基础教材；前 100 页左右的内​​容，任何勤奋的读者都可以读懂。晶体管的发明者在一系列期刊文章和他们获得诺贝尔奖后发表的演讲中都提到了晶体管的发明；许多内容可以在诺贝尔基金会的网站www.nobel.se上找到。国家地理杂志的书籍《那些有创造力的美国人》（华盛顿特区：国家地理学会，1971 年）对晶体管及其创始人进行了通俗的介绍；乔治·L·特里格的《20 世纪物理学的里程碑实验》（纽约：Crane, Russak，1975 年）则提供了更技术性的介绍。

William Shockley’s definitive Electrons and Holes in Semiconductors, with Applications to Transistor Electronics (New York: Van Nostrand, 1950) is the basic text on semiconductor physics and on Shockley’s way of thinking; for the first hundred pages or so, it is accessible to any diligent reader. The invention of the transistor has been related by the inventors in a series of journal articles and in the lectures they delivered upon receiving the Nobel Prize; many can be found on the Nobel Foundation’s Web site, www.nobel.se. A National Geographic book, Those Inventive Americans (Washington, D.C.: National Geographic Society, 1971), provides a popularized look at the transistor and its fathers; a somewhat more technical presentation is offered in George L. Trigg, Landmark Experiments in 20th-Century Physics (New York: Crane, Russak, 1975).

除了这本书之外，关于 Jack Kilby 和 Robert Noyce 的介绍很少。Tom Wolfe于 1983 年 12 月为《时尚先生》杂志撰写了一篇关于 Noyce 的精彩文章《The Tinkerings of Robert Noyce》，该文章收录在他的文集《Hooking Up》（纽约：Farrar, Straus and Giroux，2000 年）中。德国人 Hans Queisser 在《The Conquest of the Microchip》（马萨诸塞州剑桥：哈佛大学出版社，1988 年）中对这个故事进行了有趣的欧洲中心主义解读。最近出版的大多数其他有关芯片历史的书籍似乎都毫无羞耻地借鉴了这本书；有些提到了这本书作为参考，有些则没有。德州仪器公司有理由自豪地在其网站www.ti.com/corp/docs/kilbyctr/jackstclair.shtml上保存了一个很好的 Jack Kilby 档案。

Except for this book, there is very little between covers about Jack Kilby and Robert Noyce. Tom Wolfe wrote a terrific article about Noyce, “The Tinkerings of Robert Noyce,” for Esquire magazine in December 1983, and it appears in his collection Hooking Up (New York: Farrar, Straus and Giroux, 2000). The German Hans Queisser takes a curiously Eurocentric view of the story in The Conquest of the Microchip (Cambridge, Mass.: Harvard University Press, 1988). Most of the other recent books dealing with the history of the chip appear to have borrowed shamelessly from this one; some mention this book as a source, some do not. Texas Instruments, with justified pride, maintains a good Jack Kilby archive on its Web site at www.ti.com/corp/docs/kilbyctr/jackstclair.shtml.

想要深入了解专利法的读者可以从专利局网站www.uspto.gov获得大量有趣且具有指导意义的小册子。若要了解更详细的历史和法律信息，我发现最好的单卷资料来源是 Peter D. Rosenberg 的《专利法基础》（纽约：Clark Boardman，1975 年）。

A reader who would like to delve deeper into patent law can obtain a number of interesting and instructive pamphlets from the Patent Office Web site, www.uspto.gov. For more detailed historical and legal information, the best one-volume source I have found is Peter D. Rosenberg, Patent Law Fundamentals (New York: Clark Boardman, 1975).

詹姆斯·R·纽曼 (James R. Newman) 所著的四卷本《数学世界》（纽约：西蒙与舒斯特出版社，1956 年）讨论了二进制系统和数字计算机操作背后的其他数学原理；这套优秀书籍的第三卷还包含一个关于布尔逻辑的有用章节。然而，对数学感兴趣的读者将从埃里克·贝尔 (Eric Bell) 诙谐、富有洞察力且总体上精彩的著作中获得最大的乐趣：与本书所涵盖内容直接相关的两本书是《数学：科学的女王和仆人》（纽约：麦格劳-希尔出版社，1951 年）和《数学之人》 （纽约：西蒙与舒斯特出版社，1937 年）；后者包括乔治·布尔的精彩肖像。玛丽·埃弗里斯特·布尔的《布尔选集》（数学教师协会，1972 年）中也有有趣的布尔人物。我们应该感谢多佛出版社保留了乔治·布尔杰作《思想的规律》（纽约：多佛出版社，1951 年）的平装本。目前还没有克劳德·香农的传记，但读者可能会对开创了信息理论这一新兴领域的那本书感兴趣——即克劳德·E·香农的《通信的数学理论》（香槟：伊利诺伊大学出版社，1949 年）。

The binary system and other mathematical principles underlying digital computer operations are discussed in the four-volume The World of Mathematics by James R. Newman (New York: Simon & Schuster, 1956); volume 3 of this excellent set also includes a useful section on Boolean logic. The reader who is interested in math, though, will derive the most pleasure from the witty, insightful, and generally marvelous books of Eric Bell: two that pertain directly to material covered in this book are Mathematics, Queen and Servant of Science (New York: McGraw-Hill, 1951) and Men of Mathematics (New York: Simon & Schuster, 1937); the latter includes a fine portrait of George Boole. There is also interesting Booleana in Mary Everest Boole, A Boolean Anthology (Association of Teachers of Mathematics, 1972). Dover Press deserves our gratitude for keeping in print a paperback version of George Boole’s masterpiece, The Laws of Thought (New York: Dover Publications, 1951). There is as yet no biography of Claude Shannon, but a reader might be interested in the book that launched the burgeoning field of information theory—that is, Claude E. Shannon, The Mathematical Theory of Communication (Champaign: University of Illinois Press, 1949).

计算机历史刚刚成为一门独立的学科，毫无疑问，将会有一些关于冯·诺依曼、图灵和其他计算机先驱的优秀书籍问世。约瑟夫·C·贾拉塔诺的《计算机技术基础》（印第安纳波利斯：霍华德·W·萨姆斯出版社，1982 年）中有一篇很好的通史。赫尔曼·戈德斯坦的《计算机从帕斯卡到冯·诺依曼》（新泽西州普林斯顿：普林斯顿大学出版社，1972 年）是这一文献的重要贡献，这本书的组织方式很奇怪，但具有只有现代电子计算机诞生时在场的人才能传达的直接性。安德鲁·霍奇斯的《阿兰·图灵：谜》（纽约：西蒙与舒斯特出版社，1983 年）和史蒂夫·J·海姆斯的《约翰 ·冯·诺依曼和诺伯特·维纳》（马萨诸塞州剑桥：麻省理工学院出版社，1980 年）是第一部完整的传记。冯·诺依曼的开创性论文“电子计算仪器逻辑设计的初步讨论”被转载于约翰·迪博尔德编辑的《计算机世界》（纽约：兰登书屋，1973 年）。

Computer history is just now emerging as an academic discipline of its own, and there will no doubt be some fine books written on the work of von Neumann, Turing, and other computer pioneers. There is a good general history in Joseph C. Giarratano, Foundations of Computer Technology (Indianapolis: Howard W. Sams, 1982). An important contribution to this literature is Herman Goldstine’s The Computer from Pascal to von Neumann (Princeton, N.J.: Princeton University Press, 1972), which is strangely organized but has the immediacy that could be conveyed only by one who was present at the creation of the modem electronic computer. Andrew Hodges, Alan Turing: The Enigma (New York: Simon & Schuster, 1983), and Steve J. Heims, John von Neumann and Norbert Wiener (Cambridge, Mass.: MIT Press, 1980), are the first complete biographies. Von Neumann’s seminal paper “Preliminary Discussion of the Logical Design of an Electronic Computing Instrument” is reprinted in John Diebold, ed., The World of the Computer (New York: Random House, 1973).

关于集成电路、微处理器、计算器和计算机内部工作原理的书籍数量之多，远非一个人可以阅读的。Jacob Millman 教授的标准教材，也就是我入门的那本，已经由我的同事更新：Jacob Millman 和 Arvin Grabel 的《微电子学》（纽约：McGraw-Hill，1987 年）。这本书非常出色，但对于非工程师来说可能有点吃力。另一个极端是 Larry Gonick 的《计算机 科学卡通指南》（纽约：Barnes & Noble，1983 年），这本书既有趣又信息量很大。IEEE 出版了一本关于逻辑电路的优秀入门书，John Gregg 的《理解布尔代数、数字电路 和集合逻辑》（加利福尼亚州洛斯阿拉米托斯：IEEE Press，1998 年）。

There are far more books than any one person could read on the inner workings of integrated circuits, microprocessors, calculators, and computers. Professor Jacob Millman’s standard text, the one that got me started, has been updated by a colleague: Jacob Millman and Arvin Grabel, Microelectronics (New York: McGraw-Hill, 1987). It is excellent but can be heavy going for the non-engineer. At the other end of the scale is Larry Gonick, The Cartoon Guide to Computer Science (New York: Barnes & Noble, 1983), which manages to be hilarious and quite informative at the same time. The IEEE put out a good primer on logic circuits, John Gregg, Understanding Boolean Algebra, Digital Circuits and the Logic of Sets (Los Alamitos, Calif.: IEEE Press, 1998).

本书中的 DIM-I 计算器在一定程度上基于 Albert Paul Malvino 在《数字计算机电子学：微处理器简介》（纽约：麦格劳-希尔出版社，1983 年）中设计的“尽可能简单”的计算机。其他介绍计算机如何获得答案的书籍包括 Gene McWhorter 的《理解数字电子学》（达拉斯：德州仪器学习中心，1978 年）；Rodnay Zaks 的《从芯片到系统：微处理器简介》 （加利福尼亚州阿拉米达：Sybex，1981 年）；以及 Adam Osborne 的三卷系列《微型计算机简介》（加利福尼亚州伯克利：Osborne/McGraw-Hill，1982 年）。

The DIM-I calculator in this book is based to some degree on the “Simple as Possible” computer designed by Albert Paul Malvino in Digital Computer Electronics: An Introduction to Microprocessors (New York: McGraw-Hill, 1983). Other books describing how a computer gets the answer include Gene McWhorter, Understanding Digital Electronics (Dallas: Texas Instruments Learning Center, 1978); Rodnay Zaks, From Chips to Systems: An Introduction to Microprocessors (Alameda, Calif.: Sybex, 1981); and the three-volume series by Adam Osborne, An Introduction to Microcomputers (Berkeley, Calif.: Osborne/McGraw-Hill, 1982).

近年来，大量有关日本管理的书籍涌入美国，其中几本讨论了日本在半导体电子领域的竞争。Paul duGay 等人的《索尼随身听的故事》 （加利福尼亚州千橡市：Sage，1997 年）是日本成功的一个极佳案例研究。关于 W. Edwards Deming 这个有趣人物的主要资料来源是 Deming 博士自己的著作《质量、生产力和竞争地位》（马萨诸塞州剑桥：麻省理工学院出版社，1982 年）。

The flood of books on Japanese management that has poured forth upon this country in recent years includes several that discuss Japanese competition in semiconductor electronics. An excellent case study of Japanese success is Paul duGay et al., The Story of the Sony Walkman (Thousand Oaks, Calif.: Sage, 1997). The key source on that intriguing figure W. Edwards Deming is Dr. Deming’s own text, Quality, Productivity, and Competitive Position (Cambridge, Mass.: MIT Press, 1982).

对于那些想知道数字革命将走向何方的人来说，理查德·特顿的《量子点》（纽约：牛津大学出版社，1995 年）对集成电路可以集成到什么程度以及当半导体芯片最终饱和时可以使用哪些技术进行了相当技术性的描述。乔治·吉尔德在《微观世界：经济学和技术的量子 革命》（纽约：西蒙与舒斯特出版社，1989 年）中以有趣的方式思考了数字未来的经济学。

For those who want to know where the digital revolution is heading, Richard Turton’s The Quantum Dot (New York: Oxford University Press, 1995) offers a fairly technical description of how much further the integrated circuit can be integrated, and what technology is available when semiconductor chips are finally saturated. The economics of the digital future are pondered in interesting fashion by George Gilder in Microcosm: The Quantum Revolution in Economics and Technology (New York: Simon & Schuster, 1989).

笔记

NOTES

（更详细的出版信息请参阅《来源说明》。）

(Fuller publishing information appears in A Note about Sources.)

第1章：整体理念

Chapter 1: The Monolithic Idea

教科书中表彰的：参见 Jacob Millman 的《微电子学》，第 xxii 页。

honored in the textbooks: Cf. Jacob Millman, Microelectronics, p. xxii.

愿意忽视：“2000 年诺贝尔物理学奖”，瑞典皇家科学院，2000 年 10 月 10 日。

willing to overlook: “The Nobel Prize in Physics, 2000,” Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences, Oct. 10, 2000.

他只希望……杰克很高兴……有些疑虑：对杰克·基尔比的采访。

he only hoped . . . Jack had been delighted . . . some misgivings: Interview with Jack Kilby.

还原钛酸盐电容器：美国专利号2,841,508（1958年）。

reduced titanate capacitor: U.S. Patent No. 2,841,508 (1958).

滑石封装晶体管：Kilby，《滑石封装晶体管放大器》，《电子学》， 1956 年 10 月。

steatite-packaged transistor: Kilby, “Transistor Amplifier Packaged in Steatite,” Electronics, October 1956.

就是那种迷恋：对基尔比的采访。

It was that infatuation: Interview with Kilby.

技术期刊对此的称呼：参见 Robert Noyce 的“互连”，IEEE 论文集， 1964 年 12 月，第 1648 页及后续页；Jack A. Morton 的“微电子困境”，国际科学与技术， 1966 年 7 月，第 38 页。

the technical journals called it: Cf. Robert Noyce, “Interconnections,” Proceedings of the IEEE, December 1964, p. 1648 ff.; Jack A. Morton, “The Microelectronics Dilemma,” International Science & Technology, July 1966, p. 38.

“神经质”：GWA Dummer，《极小电路的进展》，《新科学家》， 1963 年 2 月 7 日，第 283-84 页。

the “neuristor”: G.W.A. Dummer, “Progress with Extremely Small Elec. Circuits,” New Scientist, Feb. 7, 1963, pp. 283–84.

《生活》杂志记者：《生活》， 1956 年 11 月 5 日。

a Life magazine reporter: Life, Nov. 5, 1956.

据说正在进行：对 Kilby 的采访。

was said to be working on: Interview with Kilby.

“他很热情，但是……”：Kilby，《集成电路的发明》，IEEE 电子设备学报， 1976 年 7 月，第 650 页。

“He was enthused, but . . .”: Kilby, “Invention of the Integrated Circuit,” IEEE Transactions on Electron Devices, July 1976, p. 650.

“我非常……”：对威利斯·阿德科克的采访。

“I was very . . .”: Interview with Willis Adcock.

“如果我们建造……”：对罗伯特·诺伊斯的采访。

“If we built . . .”: Interview with Robert Noyce.

“...这将是可取的...”：诺伊斯 1959 年 1 月的实验室笔记本（副本在作者的文件中）；另见“集成电路的起源”，IEEE Spectrum， 1976 年 8 月，第 47 页。

“. . . it would be desirable . . .”: Noyce’s lab notebook for January 1959 (copy in author’s file); also “The Genesis of the Integrated Circuit,” IEEE Spectrum, August 1976, p. 47.

“有一个巨大的……”：对诺伊斯的采访。

“There was a tremendous . . .”: Interview with Noyce.

每秒约 10,000 次：参见《科学美国人》， 1982 年 1 月，第 124 页。

about 10,000 times in a second: Cf. Scientific American, January 1982, p. 124.

英国著名著作有：Ernest Braun 和 Stuart MacDonald，《微型革命》，第 16 页。

known in England: Ernest Braun and Stuart MacDonald, Revolution in Miniature, p. 16.

调试：Joseph C. Giarratano，《计算机技术基础》。

debugging: Joseph C. Giarratano, Foundations of Computer Technology.

第一台晶体管收音机：参见《Circuit News》， 1979 年 4 月 15 日。

The first transistor radio: Cf. Circuit News, Apr. 15, 1979.

“...的解释”：《工程索引》， 1953 年。

“Interpretation of . . .”: Engineering Index, 1953.

“Le Transistron 。 。 ”：同上，1955 年。

“Le Transistron . . .”: Ibid., 1955.

“Circuito...”：同上。

“Circuito . . .”: Ibid.

“张量分析...”：同上。

“Tensoranalysis . . .”: Ibid.

“佩列霍德纳亚。 。 ”：同上，1958 年。

“Perekhodnaya . . .”: Ibid., 1958.

“成功故事……”：同上，1957 年。

“Success Story . . .”: Ibid., 1957.

“晶体管钥匙……”：同上，1953 年。

“Transistors Key . . .”: Ibid., 1953.

“方法”。 。 ”：同上，1962 年。

“Méthodes . . .”: Ibid., 1962.

“极好……”：同上，1953 年。

“Fabulous . . .”: Ibid., 1953.

“转换……”：同上，1962 年。

“Switching . . .”: Ibid., 1962.

“电子……”：同上，1961 年。

“Electronic . . .”: Ibid., 1961.

“评论……”：同上，1959 年。

“Comment . . .”: Ibid., 1959.

“设计……”：同上，1960 年。

“Design . . .”: Ibid., 1960.

有 350,000 件电子产品：Horace D. Gilbert 编辑，《Miniaturization》（纽约：Reinhold，1961 年），第 3 页。

had 350,000 electronic: Horace D. Gilbert, ed., Miniaturization (New York: Reinhold, 1961), p. 3.

控制数据 CD 1604：对 Kilby 的采访；Electronics， 1980 年 4 月，第 81 页。

the Control Data CD 1604: Interview with Kilby; Electronics, April 1980, p. 81.

“一段时间以来... ”：Jack A. Morton，载于《IRE 会议纪要》， 1958 年 6 月，第 955 页及后续页。

“For some time now . . .”: Jack A. Morton, in Proceedings of the IRE, June 1958, p. 955 ff.

“每个元素必须...”：Morton，《国际科学与技术》， 1966 年 7 月，第 38 页。

“Each element must . . .”: Morton, in International Science & Technology, July 1966, p. 38.

皇家雷达机构：Braun 和 MacDonald，第 108 页。

Royal Radar Establishment: Braun and MacDonald, p. 108.

“倾向于加剧...”：Patrick Haggerty，载于《IEEE 论文集》， 1964 年 12 月，第 1648 页。

“tend to exacerbate . . .”: Patrick Haggerty, in Proceedings of the IEEE, December 1964, p. 1648.

总标题为《电子新闻》， 1982 年 1 月 25 日，第 16 页。

under the general title: Electronics News, Jan. 25, 1982, p. 16.

Operation Tinkertoy: Kilby，载于《电子设备汇刊》， 1976 年 7 月，第 648 页。

Operation Tinkertoy: Kilby, in Transactions on Electron Devices, July 1976, p. 648.

“在民用设备中……”：《电子学》， 1957 年 10 月 1 日，第 178 页。

“In civilian equipment . . .”: Electronics, Oct. 1, 1957, p. 178.

设计师尝试了冗余：参见 Kilby，《电子学》， 1959 年 8 月 7 日，第 111 页。

designers tried redundancy: Cf. Kilby, in Electronics, Aug. 7, 1959, p. 111.

“在你成为……”之后：对罗伯特·诺伊斯的采访。

“After you become . . .”: Interview with Robert Noyce.

“那是一种……”：同上。

“It was a situation . . .”: Ibid.

“那些事情...”：对 Kilby 的采访。

“The things that . . .”: Interview with Kilby.

“很大一部分……”：诺伊斯，《科学美国人》， 1977 年 9 月，第 64 页。

“A large segment . . .”: Noyce, in Scientific American, September 1977, p. 64.

“只是……”：对 Kilby 的采访。

“There was just . . .”: Interview with Kilby.

“很明显……”：《科学美国人》， 1977 年 9 月，第 64 页。

“It was clear . . .”: Scientific American, September 1977, p. 64.

理查德·费曼 (Richard Feynman) 曾说过：费曼，《发现事物的乐趣》，（马萨诸塞州剑桥：Perseus，1999 年），第 1 章。

Richard Feynman put it: Feynman, The Pleasure of Finding Things Out, (Cambridge, Mass.: Perseus, 1999), chap. 1.

“第二次工业革命”：美国国家科学院，《微结构科学、工程与技术》， 1979 年，第 1 页。

“Second Industrial Revolution”: National Academy of Sciences, Microstructure Science, Engineering & Technology, 1979, p. 1.

“最了不起的……”：汤姆·福雷斯特（Tom Forester）编辑的《微电子 革命》（马萨诸塞州剑桥：麻省理工学院出版社，1981 年），第 1 页。

“the most remarkable . . .”: In Tom Forester, ed., The Microelectronics Revolution, (Cambridge, Mass.: MIT Press, 1981), p. 1.

“集成电路是……”：对诺伊斯的采访。

“Integrated circuits are . . .”: Interview with Noyce.

第二章：思考的意志

Chapter 2: The Will to Think

1883 年 3 月首次观测到：罗伯特·科诺特（Robert Conot），《一连串的 幸运》，第 337 页；艾萨克·阿西莫夫（Isaac Asimov），《理解物理学》，第 3 卷（纽约：沃克，1966 年），第 42 页。

observed for the first time in March 1883: Robert Conot, A Streak of Luck, p. 337; Isaac Asimov, Understanding Physics, vol. 3 (New York: Walker, 1966), p. 42.

他认为它没有前途：Conot，第337页及后续页；Asimov，第3卷，第42页。

he saw no future in it: Conot, p. 337 ff.; Asimov, vol. 3, p. 42.

“零时……”：乔治·P·汤姆森爵士，JJ Thomson，第 20 页。

“the zero hour . . .”: Sir George P. Thomson, J. J. Thomson, p. 20.

“嗯，我不是科学家……”：马修·约瑟夫森，《爱迪生》，第 283 页。

“Well, I’m not a scientist . . .”: Matthew Josephson, Edison, p. 283.

点和划：Conot，第 122 页。

Dot and Dash: Conot, p. 122.

《纽约每日图表》：同上，第 113 页。

New York Daily Graphic: Ibid., p. 113.

爱迪生去世时：约瑟夫森，第 484-85 页。

When Edison died: Josephson, pp. 484–85.

“头发，开始……”：同上，第 132 页。

“The hair, beginning . . .”: Ibid., p. 132.

Perseverantia omnia vincit 。 。 。 ”。 。 。 99% 排汗”：Conot。

Perseverantia omnia vincit . . . “. . . 99 percent perspiration”: Conot.

“至少我们知道 8,000……”：同上。

“at least we know 8,000 . . .”: Ibid.

“充满拉丁语……”；“ignorameter”：Josephson，第 440、442 页。

“filled up with Latin . . .”; “ignorameter”: Josephson, pp. 440, 442.

给他命名为“文化”：Conot，第 133 页。

named him “Culture”: Conot, p. 133.

很快被称为爱迪生效应：约瑟夫森，第 278 页。参见阿西莫夫，第 3 卷，第 42 页。

quickly dubbed the Edison Effect: Josephson, p. 278. Cf. Asimov, vol. 3, p. 42.

“我从来没有...过萨凡世界”：约瑟夫森，第 278 页；科诺特，第 337 页。

“I have never . . . the Savanic world”: Josephson, p. 278; Conot, p. 337.

我们今天仍然谈论“当前”：S. Handel，《电子革命》，第 20-21 页。

we still talk today of “current”: S. Handel, The Electronic Revolution, pp. 20–21.

“几年后，所有伟大的...”：JG Crowther，《卡文迪什 实验室》，第 38 页。

“that in a few years all the great . . .”: J. G. Crowther, The Cavendish Laboratory, p. 38.

三一奖；1881 年论文；1884 年获奖：Crowther；G. Thomson，第 20-24 页；JJ Thomson，《回忆与反思​​》。

Trinity Prize; 1881 paper; succeeded in 1884: Crowther; G. Thomson, pp. 20–24; J. J. Thomson, Recollections & Reflections.

“事情已经进展得相当顺利……”：Crowther，第 109 页。

“Things have come to a pretty pass . . .”: Crowther, p. 109.

“JJ 大部分时间都花在……”：G. Thomson，第 114 页。

“J.J. spent a good part of most days . . .”: G. Thomson, p. 114.

在他的回忆录中：JJ Thomson，第 435 页。

In his memoirs: J. J. Thomson, p. 435.

“在布满灰尘的实验室里，在线圈、蜡和麻线中间……”：G. Thomson，第 98 页。

“In the dusty lab’ratory, / ’Mid the coils and wax and twine . . .”: G. Thomson, p. 98.

“我最近做了……”；“小体”：布拉格和波特编辑，皇家理工学院图书馆，第 43、48 页。

“I have lately made . . .”; “corpuscles”: Bragg and Porter, eds., Royal Institute Library of Science, pp. 43, 48.

弗莱明下定了决心……“有一个年轻人……”……“科学流氓行为”：JT McGregor-Morris，《阀门的发明者》，第 62、66 页。

Fleming was determined . . . “There was a young fellow . . .” . . . “scientific hooliganism”: J. T. McGregor-Morris, The Inventor of the Valve, pp. 62, 66.

被称为晶体装置：参见阿西莫夫，第 3 卷，第 95 页。

came to be known as crystal sets: Cf. Asimov, vol. 3, p. 95.

我在思考……：约翰·A·弗莱明，《大众广播》， 3 月 19 日，第 175 页。

I was pondering . . .: John A. Fleming, Popular Radio, Mar. 19, p. 175.

“如此敏捷...”：弗莱明，《电力五十年》，第 335 页。

“So nimble are . . .”: Fleming, Fifty Years of Electricity, p. 335.

“荒谬而又故意……”：Gerald FJ Tyne， 《真空管传奇》 （印第安纳波利斯：萨姆斯出版社，1977 年）。

“absurd and deliberately . . .”: Gerald F. J. Tyne, Saga of the Vacuum Tube (Indianapolis: Sams, 1977).

“更具革命性的一步……”：乔治特·卡内尔（Georgette Carneal），《太空征服者》 ，第 187 页。

“a more revolutionary step . . .”: Georgette Carneal, A Conqueror of Space, p. 187.

“很少有发明有如此多的创始人”：艾萨克·阿西莫夫，《阿西莫夫科学技术传记百科全书》。

“few inventions have had so many fathers”: Isaac Asimov, Asimov’s Biographical Encyclopedia of Science and Technology.

“通常称为...”：《电子新闻》， 1982 年 1 月 25 日，第 2 部分，第 10 页。

“Commonly known as . . .”: Electronics News, Jan. 25, 1982, sec. 2, p. 10.

“网格”；“放大装置……”：阿西莫夫，《理解物理学》，第 3 卷，第 42 页；卡内尔；泰恩。

“grid”; “Device for Amplifying . . .”: Asimov, Understanding Physics, vol. 3, p. 42; Carneal; Tyne.

图像显像管：参见阿西莫夫《理解物理学》第 3 卷，第 50 页。

iconoscope: Cf. Asimov, Understanding Physics, vol. 3, p. 50.

“雷达”……晶体整流器：参见 Handel，第 80-81 页。

“radar” . . . Crystal rectifiers: Cf. Handel, pp. 80–81.

“化身……”；“他不是，因为爱因斯坦是……”：CP Snow，《物理学家》，第 51 页及后续页。

“the incarnation . . .”; “He was not, as Einstein was . . .”: C. P. Snow, The Physicists, p. 51 ff.

Contraria sunt supplementa： John Daintith、Sarah Mitchell 和 Elizabeth Tootill 编，《科学家传记百科全书》（纽约：Facts on File，1981 年），第 87 页。

Contraria sunt complementa: John Daintith, Sarah Mitchell, and Elizabeth Tootill, eds., A Biographical Encyclopedia of Scientists, (New York: Facts on File, 1981), p. 87.

“在这张图片中，我们看到了惊人的……”：诺贝尔物理学讲座， 1922-41 年，第 8 页。

“In this picture we see a striking . . .”: Nobel Lectures—Physics, 1922–41, p. 8.

“空置的停车位……”：威廉·肖克利， 《半导体中的电子和空穴》 ，第 8 页。

“the vacant parking place . . .”: William Shockley, Electrons and Holes in Semiconductors, p. 8.

N型；P型：参见Jacob Millman，《微电子学》，第 12-13 页。

N-type; P-type: Cf. Jacob Millman, Microelectronics, pp. 12–13.

“今天我突然想到……”：肖克利，《结型晶体管的概念之路》，《IEEE 电子器件学报》， 1976 年 7 月，第 603 页。

“It has today occurred to me . . .”: Shockley, “The Path to the Conception of the Junction Transistor,” IEEE Transactions on Electron Devices, July 1976, p. 603.

“尝试最简单的案例”；“思考的意愿”；“用这四个词……”：同上；第 600、599-600 页。

“Try simplest cases”; “the will to think”; “In these four words . . .”: Ibid.; pp. 600, 599–600.

“空穴波包的波函数A（φ）……”：Shockley，《半导体中的电子和空穴》，第 444 页。

“the wave function A (φ) for the hole-wave packet . . .”: Shockley, Electrons and Holes in Semiconductors, p. 444.

讲授了一门新生研讨课：“美丽新威廉·肖克利”，《时尚先生》 1973 年 1 月，第 130 页。

taught a freshman seminar: “Brave New William Shockley,” Esquire, January 1973, p. 130 ff.

“思考思考……”：IEEE 学生期刊， 1968 年 9 月，第 11-16 页。

“THINKING about THINKING . . .”: IEEE Student Journal, September 1968, pp. 11–16.

“劣生学”；“倒退的进化……”：《时尚先生》， 1973 年 1 月。参见《纽约时报》， 1970 年 5 月 3 日，第 58 页，以及 1970 年 1 月 17 日，第 30 页（肖克利致编辑的信）。

“dysgenics”; “retrogressive evolution . . .”: Esquire, January 1973. Cf. The New York Times, May 3, 1970, p. 58, and Jan. 17, 1970, p. 30 (letter to editor from Shockley).

“我们国家的人性素质的下降”：《纽约时报》， 1970年1月17日，第30页。

“decline of our nation’s human quality”: The New York Times, Jan. 17, 1970, p. 30.

“我的研究不可避免地引导我……”：同上，1973 年 12 月 5 日，第 38 页。

“My research leads me inescapably . . .”: Ibid., Dec. 5, 1973, p. 38.

一项社会政策：同上，1973 年 12 月 13 日，第 95 页。

a social policy to deal with: Ibid., Dec. 13, 1973, p. 95.

“Off Pig Shockley”；照片；麦克风出现故障：《Esquire》， 1973 年 1 月，第 130 页及后续页。

“Off Pig Shockley”; photograph; microphone went on the blink: Esquire, January 1973, p. 130 ff.

追求共和党提名：《纽约时报》， 1982 年 2 月 12 日，第 16 页。

pursued the Republican nomination: The New York Times, Feb. 12, 1982, p. 16.

“迷人”：对罗伯特·诺伊斯的采访。

“charming”: Interview with Robert Noyce.

“真空管和热电子学……”；“别担心，沃尔特……”：“沃尔特·豪瑟·布拉顿”，贝尔实验室记录，1972 年 12 月，第 339 页及后续页。

“the vacuum tube and thermionics . . .”; “Don’t worry, Walter . . .”: “Walter Houser Brattain,” Bell Laboratories Record, December 1972, p. 339 ff.

“人们确实需要……”：《诺贝尔物理学讲座——1942-62 年》（纽约：爱思唯尔，1964 年），第 377 页（布拉顿）。

“one indeed needs to be . . .”: Nobel Lectures—Physics, 1942–62, (New York: Elsevier, 1964), p. 377 (Brattain).

“然而我强烈地感觉到……”；“我所谴责的事情……”：贝尔实验室记录， 1972 年 12 月，第 339 页。

“I feel strongly, however . . .”; “The thing I deplore . . .”: Bell Laboratories Record, December 1972, p. 339.

“如果我把它摆动得恰到好处”：George L. Trigg，《20世纪物理学的里程碑实验》，第 149 页。

“if I wiggled it just right”: George L. Trigg, Landmark Experiments in 20th-Century Physics, p. 149.

到 1946 年...半导体二极管的运行：《20 世纪技术史》 ，第 2 部分，第 1117 页。

By 1946 . . . the operation of the semiconductor diode: A History of Technology in the 20th Century, pt. 2, p. 1117.

“听到放大的语音……”：Shockley，IEEE Transactions， 1976 年 7 月，第 611 页。

“Hearing speech amplified . . .”: Shockley, in IEEE Transactions, July 1976, p. 611.

“我为该组织的成功感到非常高兴……”：同上，第 612 页。

“My elation with the group’s success . . .”: Ibid., p. 612.

第3 章：一个不明显的解决方案

Chapter 3: A Nonobvious Solution

“...几张幻灯片”：对瑞典学院托尔德·克莱松博士的采访。

“. . . a couple of slides”: Interview with Dr. Tord Claesson, Swedish Academy.

基尔比 (Kilby) 语录：对 Jack Kilby 的采访。

Quotations from Kilby: Interviews with Jack Kilby.

“问题的定义……”；“尽管发明是……”：Kilby，《发明家的观点》，Chemtech， 1979 年 3 月，第 66 页。

“The definition of the problem . . .”; “Although invention is . . .”: Kilby, “The Inventor’s View,” Chemtech, March 1979, p. 66.

基尔比 (Kilby) 语录：对基尔比 (Kilby) 的采访；同上。

Quotations from Kilby: Interviews with Kilby; ibid.

地球物理研究公司：“创造 TI 的人”，《财富》杂志， 1961 年 11 月。

Geophysical Research Corporation: “The Men Who Made T.I.,” Fortune, November 1961.

“我们公司现在有两个……”：威利斯·艾德考克访谈。参见《财富》杂志1961 年 11 月刊。

“Our company now has two . . .”: Interview with Willis Adcock. Cf. Fortune, November 1961.

“我觉得这很有可能……”：Kilby，《集成电路的发明》，IEEE 电子器件学报， 1976 年 7 月，第 650 页。

“I felt it likely . . .”: Kilby, “Invention of the Integrated Circuit,” IEEE Transactions on Electron Devices, July 1976, p. 650.

“如果德州仪器……”：对 Kilby 的采访。

“If Texas Instruments . . .”: Interview with Kilby.

“以下电路元件...”：Kilby 的实验室笔记本，1958 年 7 月 24 日（作者文件中的副本）。

“The following circuit elements . . .”: Kilby’s lab notebook, July 24, 1958 (copy in author’s file).

“没有人会做出……”：对 Kilby 的采访。

“Nobody would have made . . .”: Interview with Kilby.

引用 Kilby 的话：同上。

Quotations from Kilby: Ibid.

“它真的非常麻烦”：对 Adcock 的采访。

“it was pretty damn cumbersome”: Interview with Adcock.

第四章洞察力的飞跃

Chapter 4: Leap of Insight

诺伊斯名言：对罗伯特·诺伊斯的采访。

Quotations from Noyce: Interview with Robert Noyce.

“他们成就斐然……”：《哈佛商业评论》， 1980 年 5/6 月号，第 122 页。

“They’re high achievers . . .”: Harvard Business Review, May/June 1980, p. 122.

诺伊斯名言：对诺伊斯的采访。

Quotations from Noyce: Interview with Noyce.

低能气体放电：《应用物理学杂志》，第 27 卷，1956 年 8 月，第 843 页。

low-energy gas discharges: Journal of Applied Physics, vol. 27, August 1956, p. 843.

“直流晶体管电流放大系数”：IRE会议论文集， 1957年9月，第1228-43页。

“dc transistor current amplification factor”: Proceedings of the IRE, September 1957, pp. 1228–43.

“碱基扩展穿透”：对诺伊斯的采访。

“base widening punch-through”: Interview with Noyce.

半导体扩散……1000 摄氏度左右：Jacob Millman，《微电子学》，第 100 页。

Semiconductor diffusion . . . 1000 degrees centigrade or so: Jacob Millman, Microelectronics, p. 100.

将诺伊斯描述为一个内向的人：《经济学人》， 1980 年 12 月 27 日，第 63 页。

described Noyce as an introvert: The Economist, Dec. 27, 1980, p. 63.

“有一群人……”：对诺伊斯的采访。

“There was a group . . .”: Interview with Noyce.

“叛逆八人”：德克·汉森，《新炼金术士》（波士顿：小布朗，1982 年），第 92 页；另见戈登·摩尔的访谈。

“the traitorous eight”: Dirk Hanson, The New Alchemists (Boston: Little, Brown, 1982), p. 92; also, interview with Gordon Moore.

“实现……”：对诺伊斯的采访。

“the realization . . .”: Interview with Noyce.

他最初的 500 美元所获得的回报：Gene Bylinsky，《创新百万富翁》（纽约：斯克里布纳出版社，1976 年），第 61 页及后续页。

the return on his initial $500: Gene Bylinsky, The Innovation Millionaires (New York: Scribner, 1976), p. 61 ff.

“华尔街已经说过……”：《金融世界》， 1981 年 3 月 15 日，第 30 页及后续页。

“Wall Street has spoken . . .”: Financial World, Mar. 15, 1981, p. 30 ff.

“我们在这里……”：对诺伊斯的采访。

“Here we were . . .”: Interview with Noyce.

诺伊斯 (Noyce, Ralls) 语录：同上。

Quotations from Noyce, Ralls: Ibid.

“所有的碎片...”：“集成电路的起源”，IEEE Spectrum， 1976 年 8 月，第 50 页。

“all the bits and pieces . . .”: “The Genesis of the Integrated Circuit,” IEEE Spectrum, August 1976, p. 50.

“在许多应用中...”：诺伊斯 1959 年 1 月 23 日的实验室笔记本（作者档案中的副本）。

“In many applications . . .”: Noyce’s lab notebook for January 23, 1959 (copy in author’s file).

“单一电路结构...”：美国专利号2,981,877，第1页。

“a unitary circuit structure . . .”: U.S. Patent No. 2,981,877, p. 1.

第5 章： Kilby诉Noyce

Chapter 5: Kilby v. Noyce

（注：“案卷”是指在美国弗吉尼亚州阿灵顿美国专利局提交的干涉程序第 92,841 号文件，Kilby v. Noyce 。）

(Note: “Docket” refers to the file of documents submitted for Interference Proceeding No. 92,841, Kilby v. Noyce, at the U.S. Patent Office, Arlington, Virginia.)

可怕的谣言：马丁·弗莱特的证词，1964 年 7 月——记录在案。此外，还采访了 TI 专利律师梅尔文·夏普。

The terrifying rumor: Testimony of Martin Fleit, July 1964—transcript in docket. Also, interview with Melvin Sharp, patent counsel, TI.

莫舍承诺：接受夏普的采访。

Mosher promised: Interview with Sharp.

“排除权……”：美国法典——引自《专利通用信息》（华盛顿特区：美国商务部，1982 年），第 2 页。

“the right to exclude . . .”: U.S. Code—cited in General Information Concerning Patents (Washington, D.C.: U.S. Department of Commerce, 1982), p. 2.

“书面描述……”：35 USC 112。

“a written description . . .”: 35 U.S.C. 112.

可口可乐的历史：《可口可乐公司——图解简介》（亚特兰大：可口可乐公司，1974 年）；查尔斯·霍华德·坎德勒，《阿萨·格里格斯·坎德勒》（亚特兰大：埃默里大学出版社，1950 年），第 119 页。

Coca-Cola history: The Coca-Cola Co.—An Illustrated Profile (Atlanta: Coca-Cola Co., 1974); Charles Howard Candler, Asa Griggs Candler (Atlanta: Emory University Press, 1950), p. 119.

可口可乐配方的商业秘密保护：Peter D. Rosenberg，《专利法基础》，第 15-16 页。

trade secret protection of Coca-Cola formula: Peter D. Rosenberg, Patent Law Fundamentals, pp. 15–16.

碎小麦案：Kellogg Co.诉National Biscuit Co.，305 USC 111（1938）。

shredded wheat case: Kellogg Co. v. National Biscuit Co., 305 U.S.C. 111 (1938).

“可提供纸张...”： 《专利一般信息》 ，第 17 页。

“The sheets may be provided . . .”: General Information Concerning Patents, p. 17.

“新的”；“有用的”：35 USC 101；核武器没有专利：42 USC 2181。

“new”; “useful”: 35 U.S.C. 101; no patent on nuclear weapons: 42 U.S.C. 2181.

第一个电话专利：罗森伯格，第 12 页。

That first telephone patent: Rosenberg, p. 12.

“彻底背离……”及专利申请中的其他引文：美国专利号 3,138,743。

“Radically departing . . .” and other quotations from patent application: U.S. Patent No. 3,138,743.

“...应阐明最佳模式...”：35 USC 112。

“. . . shall set forth the best mode . . .”: 35 U.S.C. 112.

集成与互连： Jack Kilby 访谈；Kilby，《集成电路的发明》，《IEEE 电子器件学报》， 1976 年 7 月。

integration and interconnection: Interview with Jack Kilby; Kilby, “Invention of the Integrated Circuit,” IEEE Transactions on Electron Devices, July 1976.

“飞线图片”：对罗杰·博罗沃伊的采访。

“flying wire picture”: Interview with Roger Borovoy.

“而不是使用……”：美国专利号 3,138,743。

“Instead of using . . .”: U.S. Patent No. 3,138,743.

“我们还是全新的……”：对罗伯特·诺伊斯的采访。

“We were still a brand-new . . .”: Interview with Robert Noyce.

专利申请引文：美国专利号 2,981,877。

Quotations from patent application: U.S. Patent No. 2,981,877.

干涉程序；专利干涉委员会：35 USC 13(a)。

interference proceeding; Board of Patent Interferences: 35 U.S.C. 13(a).

收到...表格 POL-102 的副本：已归档。

received a copy of . . . Form POL-102: In docket.

“解散动议……”及其他文件：同上。

“Motion to Dissolve . . .” and other documents: Ibid.

“我在这里……”：对博罗沃伊的采访。

“Here I was . . .”: Interview with Borovoy.

“导电材料...”：美国专利号 3,138,743。

“conducting material . . .”: U.S. Patent No. 3,138,743.

专家证词：G. Pearson 教授（斯坦福大学）的证词，1964 年 10 月 9 日；R. Maurer 教授（伊利诺伊大学）的证词，1964 年 11 月 24 日（记录在案）。

experts’ testimony: Testimony of Professor G. Pearson (Stanford), Oct. 9, 1964; testimony of Professor R. Maurer (Illinois), Nov. 24, 1964 (transcripts in docket).

“请求……”及其他动议：已列入案卷。

“Request for . . .” and other motions: In docket.

Borovoy 的简报包括：“请注意这一点……”：案卷中的简报副本。

Borovoy’s brief included; “Note that this . . .”: Copy of brief in docket.

“我们并不是特别……”：专利局专利干涉委员会意见，第 92,841 号，1967 年 2 月 24 日（在案卷中）。

“we are not particularly . . .”: Opinion of the Patent Office Board of Patent Interferences, No. 92,841, Feb. 24, 1967 (in docket).

CCPA 判决：Kilby v. Noyce， 416 F2d. 1391 (CCPA, 1969)。

CCPA decision: Kilby v. Noyce, 416 F2d. 1391 (CCPA, 1969).

“驳回”：Kilby v. Noyce， 1970 年 10 月 12 日驳回（在案卷中）。

“Denied”: Kilby v. Noyce, cert. denied Oct. 12, 1970 (in docket).

1966 年夏天：对 Sharp 和 Borovoy 的采访；《电子 新闻》， 1966 年 5 月 9 日，第 1 页。

in the summer of 1966: Interviews with Sharp and Borovoy; Electronics News, May 9, 1966, p. 1.

“专利上诉法院发现……”：参见《电子新闻》， 1969 年 11 月 24 日，第 63 页。

“Patent Appeals Court Finds . . .”: Cf. Electronics News, Nov. 24, 1969, p. 63.

第6 章：真正的奇迹

Chapter 6: The Real Miracle

1959 年 3 月 24 日；“固体电路”：对 Jack Kilby 和 Willis Adcock 的采访。参见Electronics， 1959 年 3 月 13 日。

March 24, 1959; “solid circuits”: Interviews with Jack Kilby and Willis Adcock. Cf. Electronics, Mar. 13, 1959.

德州仪器 (TI) 总裁的夸张预测……《电子学，创新时代》编辑部，第 84 页。

a lavish prediction . . . from TI’s president: Editors of Electronics, An Age of Innovation, p. 84.

“这并不是什么轰动事件”：对 Kilby 的采访。

“It wasn’t a sensation”: Interview with Kilby.

在其特刊：电子学， 1959 年 3 月 13 日。

In its special issue: Electronics, Mar. 13, 1959.

“火柴头大小的固态电路”：同上，1959 年 4 月 3 日，第 11 页。

“match-head size solid-state circuit”: Ibid., Apr. 3, 1959, p. 11.

“遭到了很多批评...”：对 Kilby 的采访。

“There was a lot of flak . . .”: Interview with Kilby.

批评者指出了三点：“这些反对意见是……”：Kilby，《集成电路的发明》，IEEE 电子设备学报， 1976 年 7 月，第 652 页。

The critics identified three; “These objections were . . .”: Kilby, “Invention of the Integrated Circuit,” IEEE Transactions on Electron Devices, July 1976, p. 652.

一个常见的分析思路：采访罗伯特·诺伊斯 (Robert Noyce)。参见 Noyce，《微电子学》，《科学美国人》， 1977 年 9 月，第 67 页。

one common line of analysis: Interview with Robert Noyce. Cf. Noyce, “Microelectronics,” Scientific American, September 1977, p. 67.

行业巨头……保持清醒：同上；另见诺伊斯著，《科学美国人》， 1977 年 9 月，第 68 页。

the giants of the industry . . . kept themselves clear: Ibid.; also, Noyce, Scientific American, September 1977, p. 68.

“新组件之间的协同作用……”：诺伊斯，《科学美国人》， 1977 年 9 月，第 63 页。

“The synergy between a new component . . .”: Noyce, Scientific American, September 1977, p. 63.

传统经济被逆转：同上

traditional economies were reversed: Ibid.

除了斑马：苏斯博士，《除了斑马》（纽约：兰登书屋，1955 年）。

On Beyond Zebra: Dr. Seuss, On Beyond Zebra (New York: Random House, 1955).

位置符号；符号的发明：艾萨克·阿西莫夫（Isaac Asimov），《阿西莫夫论数字》（纽约花园城：Doubleday，1977 年），第 21-28 页。

positional notation; invention of a symbol: Isaac Asimov, Asimov on Numbers (Garden City, N.Y.: Doubleday, 1977), pp. 21–28.

补码减法：Albert Paul Malvino，《数字计算机 电子学》，第 81-84 页。

ones-complement subtraction: Albert Paul Malvino, Digital Computer Electronics, pp. 81–84.

“被告拥有强大的大脑”：安德鲁·霍奇斯（Andrew Hodges），《艾伦·图灵： 谜团》，第 474 页。

“Accused Had Powerful Brain”: Andrew Hodges, Alan Turing: The Enigma, p. 474.

“有一天，女士们会……”；“大约五十年后。”：同上，第 418、417 页。

“One day ladies will take . . .”; “in about fifty years’ time.”: Ibid., pp. 418, 417.

电影制片人斯坦利·库布里克：同上，第 533 页。

The filmmaker Stanley Kubrick: Ibid., p. 533.

图灵写道，这是很自然的：同上，第 320 页。

Turing wrote, it was natural enough: Ibid., p. 320.

“我们强烈支持...”：约翰·冯·诺依曼等人，《电子计算仪器逻辑设计的初步讨论》，载于约翰·迪堡编的《计算机世界》，第 54 页。

“We feel strongly in favor . . .”: John von Neumann et al., “Preliminary Discussion of the Logical Design of an Electronic Computing Instrument,” in John Diebold, ed., The World of the Computer, p. 54.

一是人类：菲利普斯，《二进制计算》 (1936)，载于布赖恩·兰德尔编的​​《数字计算机的起源》 (纽约：Springer-Verlag，1975)，第 293 页。

One was that the human race: Phillips, “Binary Calculation” (1936), in Brian Randell, ed., The Origins of Digital Computers (New York: Springer-Verlag, 1975), p. 293.

“二进制的一个缺点……”：Diebold，第 55-56 页。

“The one disadvantage of the binary system . . .”: Diebold, pp. 55–56.

解码器：Eugene McWhorter，《了解数字电子学》，第 8-12 页。

decoder: Eugene McWhorter, Understanding Digital Electronics, pp. 8–12.

“心理洞察力的闪现”：玛丽·E·布尔，《布尔选集》，第 61、62 页；威廉·尼尔，《布尔与逻辑的复兴》，《心智》，第 57 卷（1948 年 4 月），第 152 页。

“flash of psychological insight”: Mary E. Boole, A Boolean Anthology, pp. 61, 62; William Kneale, “Boole and the Revival of Logic,” Mind, vol. 57 (April 1948), p. 152.

“不让他的孩子……”：Kneale，引自James R. Newman著《数学世界》第3卷，第1854页。

“that his children not be allowed . . .”: Kneale, quoted in James R. Newman, The World of Mathematics, vol. 3, p. 1854.

“以下论文的设计……”：乔治·布尔， 《思想定律》 ，第 1 页。

“The design of the following treatise . . .”: George Boole, The Laws of Thought, p. 1.

“三号十四行诗”：Kneale，第 57 卷。

“Sonnet to the Number Three”: Kneale, vol. 57.

“没有哪个数学家能够理解……”：M. Boole，第 68 页。

“No mere mathematician can understand . . .”: M. Boole, p. 68.

x（1 − y）（1 − z）+ y（1 − x）（1 − z）...：G.布尔，《思想定律》。

x(1 − y)(1 − z) + y(1 − x)(1 − z) . . .: G. Boole, The Laws of Thought.

x = x 2：同上，第 64 页。

x = x2: Ibid., p. 64.

“‘你很伤心，’骑士说……”：刘易斯·卡罗尔，《爱丽丝镜中奇遇记》。

“ ‘You are sad,’ the Knight said . . .”: Lewis Carroll, Through the Looking Glass.

在《数学原理》： Newman，第 3 卷，第 1894-95 页。

In Principia Mathematica: Newman, vol. 3, pp. 1894–95.

“抽象学说……”：G.布尔。

“The abstract doctrines . . .”: G. Boole.

Vannevar Bush，设计者：Herman Goldstine， 《从帕斯卡到冯·诺依曼的计算机》 ，第 90 页。

Vannevar Bush, had designed: Herman Goldstine, The Computer from Pascal to von Neumann, p. 90.

“编写计算机下棋程序”：《哲学杂志》，第 41 卷（1950 年），第 256 页。

“Programming a Computer for Playing Chess”: Philosophical Magazine, vol. 41 (1950), p. 256.

“Squdgy fez, blank jimp crwth vox!”：《纽约时报》， 1972 年 8 月 16 日，第 36 页。

“Squdgy fez, blank jimp crwth vox!”: The New York Times, Aug. 16, 1972, p. 36.

“可以执行...”：Claude Shannon，《继电器和开关电路的符号分析》，AIEE Transactions，第 57 卷（1938 年），第 722 页。

“It is possible to perform . . .”: Claude Shannon, “A Symbolic Analysis of Relay and Switching Circuits,” AIEE Transactions, vol. 57 (1938), p. 722.

“事实上，任何操作……”：同上。

“In fact, any operation . . .”: Ibid.

门：参见 Jacob Millman，《微电子学》，第 123 页。

gates: Cf. Jacob Millman, Microelectronics, p. 123.

第7章：升空

Chapter 7: Blasting Off

六种不同的新产品线...“微逻辑元素”：电子学，1961 年 3 月 31 日，第 91 页。

a new line of six different... “Micrologic elements”: Electronics, Mar. 31, 1961, p. 91.

类似的“固体电路”系列：Jack Kilby 访谈；《电子学：创新时代》编辑，第 83 页。

a similar series of “solid circuits”: Interview with Jack Kilby; Editors of Electronics, An Age of Innovation, p. 83.

售价 120 美元：《电子学》， 1961 年 3 月 31 日，第 76 页。

priced at $120: Electronics, Mar. 31, 1961, p. 76.

“这是很自然的……”：对罗伯特·诺伊斯的采访。

“There was the natural . . .”: Interview with Robert Noyce.

学习曲线：Ernest Braun 和 Stuart MacDonald，《微型革命》，第 82 页。

learning curve: Ernest Braun and Stuart MacDonald, Revolution in Miniature, p. 82.

“迫切需要太空计划...”：对 Jack Kilby 的采访。

“The space program badly needed . . .”: Interview with Jack Kilby.

美国电子公司抱怨：参见“影响世界半导体贸易的竞争因素”，美国众议院贸易小组委员会听证会，第 96-62 号，1979 年 11 月 30 日。

U.S. electronics companies complained: Cf. “Competitive Factors Influencing World Trade in Semiconductors,” Hearings before U.S. House Subcommittee on Trade, No. 96–62, Nov. 30, 1979.

1977 年发表的一项研究：Linville 和 Hogan，《科学》， 1977 年 3 月 18 日，第 1109 页。

A study published in 1977: Linville and Hogan, in Science, Mar. 18, 1977, p. 1109.

联邦政府仍然是最大的买家：《福布斯》， 1971 年 2 月 15 日，第 21 页；《布劳恩和麦克唐纳》，第 141-42 页。

federal government remained the largest buyer: Forbes, Feb. 15, 1971, p. 21; Braun and MacDonald, pp. 141–42.

“一般的经验法则……”：对诺伊斯的采访。

“The general rule of thumb . . .”: Interview with Noyce.

每个组件所要求的规范：对 Willis Adcock 的采访；Braun 和 MacDonald，第 114 页。

specifications called for every single component: Interview with Willis Adcock; Braun and MacDonald, p. 114.

测试、再测试、再再测试：Jack A. Morton，《组织创新》，第 106 页；《商业周刊》， 1962 年 4 月 14 日，第 168 页。

Testing, retesting, and re-retesting: Jack A. Morton, Organizing for Innovation, p. 106; Business Week, Apr. 14, 1962, p. 168.

服务朝三个不同的方向发展：Kilby，《集成电路的发明》，IEEE 电子器件学报， 1976 年 7 月，第 649 页。

services went off in three different directions: Kilby, “Invention of the Integrated Circuit,” IEEE Transactions on Electron Devices, July 1976, p. 649.

“分子电子学”：参见空军系统司令部， 《集成电路 的成熟》（美国空军，1966 年），第 4 页。

“molecular electronics”: Cf. Air Force Systems Command, Integrated Circuits Come of Age (United States Air Force, 1966), p. 4.

“它的想法是……”：对诺伊斯的采访。

“The idea of it was . . .”: Interview with Noyce.

“TI 始终遵循一项战略……”：对 Kilby 的采访。

“TI has always followed a strategy . . .”: Interview with Kilby.

“集成电路的发展……”：《集成电路 的成熟》，第 1 页。

“The development of integrated circuits . . .”: Integrated Circuits Come of Age, p. 1.

“几乎是一种侮辱”；“导弹计划和……”：对诺伊斯的采访。

“almost an insult”; “The missile program and the . . .”: Interview with Noyce.

民兵 II 的设计者……每月生产 4,000 块芯片：《集成电路 的成熟》，第 16 页；《创新时代》，第 325 页。

The designers of Minuteman II . . . 4,000 chips per month: Integrated Circuits Come of Age, p. 16; An Age of Innovation, p. 325.

销售量约为 500,000 台……并且再次翻了两番：Kraus，《美国半导体产业经济研究》，第 80、209 页。

About 500,000 . . . were sold . . . and quadrupled again: Kraus, An Economic Study of the U.S. Semiconductor Industry, pp. 80, 209.

“从营销角度来看……”：对 Kilby 的采访。

“From a marketing standpoint . . .”: Interview with Kilby.

第一块在商业市场上销售的芯片：《集成电路 的成熟》，第 20 页。

The first chip sold for the commercial market: Integrated Circuits Come of Age, p. 20.

1963 年平均芯片价格：《美国半导体产业报告》，美国商务部第 99 卷，第 50 页；电子工业协会，《市场数据手册》1975 年，第 84 页。

In 1963 the price of an average chip: “A Report on the U.S. Semiconductor Industry,” U.S. Commerce Department 99, p. 50; Electronic Industries Association, Market Data Book 1975, p. 84.

“一粒尘埃……”：对诺伊斯的采访。

“A single speck of dust . . .”: Interview with Noyce.

“我这样做有点开玩笑……”：采访戈登·摩尔。

“I did it sort of tongue-in-cheek . . .”: Interview with Gordon Moore.

256M 芯片：“物理学和信息革命”，《今日物理学》， 2000 年 1 月。

256M chip: “Physics and the Information Revolution,” Physics Today, January 2000.

奔腾IV：同上。

Pentium IV: Ibid.

“我们会舒适地巡航……”：Moore，《半导体行业的成本结构》，IEEE 消费电子学报， 1977 年 2 月。

“We would cruise comfortably . . .”: Moore, “The Cost Structure of the Semiconductor Industry,” IEEE Transactions Consumer Electronics, February 1977.

“进步令人惊叹……”：诺伊斯，《微电子学》，《科学美国人》， 1977 年 9 月，第 65 页。

“Progress has been astonishing . . .”: Noyce, “Microelectronics,” Scientific American, September 1977, p. 65.

IBM 推出了...System 360...竞争对手必须这样做：创新时代，第 339 页及后续页。

IBM brought out . . . System 360 . . . competitors had to: An Age of Innovation, p. 339 ff.

出版的专著：David A. Hodges，《大容量半导体存储器》，IEEE 论文集， 1968 年 7 月，第 1148 页。

A monograph that appeared: David A. Hodges, “Large-Capacity Semiconductor Memory,” IEEE Proceedings, July 1968, p. 1148.

英特尔公布了总计数据：《财富》， 1973 年 11 月，第 142 页。

Intel rang up a grand total: Fortune, November 1973, p. 142.

线性或模拟集成电路：Jacob Millman，《微电子学》，第 333 页。

linear, or analog, integrated circuit: Jacob Millman, Microelectronics, p. 333.

“我们达到了一个点……”：对摩尔的采访。

“We reached a point . . .”: Interview with Moore.

保持其爆炸式的增长率：参见摩尔的《半导体行业的成本结构》。

To maintain its explosive rate of growth: Cf. Moore, “The Cost Structure of the Semiconductor Industry.”

第8 章：内爆

Chapter 8: The Implosion

“普及性”：对 Jack Kilby 和 Willis Adcock 的采访；Robert Noyce，《微电子学》，《科学美国人》， 1977 年 9 月，第 69 页。

“Pervasiveness”: Interviews with Jack Kilby and Willis Adcock; Robert Noyce, “Microelectronics,” Scientific American, September 1977, p. 69.

“我们知道我们做得很好……”：帕特里克·哈格蒂，《新的挑战》，晶体管收音机 25 周年纪念演讲（达拉斯：德州仪器，1980 年），第 1 页。

“We knew we were doing pretty well . . .”: Patrick Haggerty, “A New Challenge,” remarks at 25th anniversary observance, transistor radio (Dallas: Texas Instruments, 1980), p. 1.

一些德州仪器公司的人说：对 Adcock 和 Terry Merryman 的采访。

Some Texas Instruments people say: Interviews with Adcock and Terry Merryman.

“如果德克萨斯州的那个小组织……”：哈格蒂，《新的挑战》，第 1 页。

“if that little outfit down in Texas . . .”: Haggerty, “A New Challenge,” p. 1.

哈格蒂开始讲话：对基尔比的采访。

Haggerty started talking: Interview with Kilby.

“我有点定义……”：同上。

“I sort of defined . . .”: Ibid.

“这真是一场悲惨的……”；“他就是那种……”：同上。

“It was a miserable . . .”; “He’s one of these guys . . .”: Ibid.

“如果你思考...你就会找到答案”：对梅里曼的采访。

“that you’re going to find an answer if you think . . .”: Interview with Merryman.

“基本规则是……”；“这样一来，所有的部分……”：同上。

“The basic rule was . . .”; “That way, all the bits . . .”: Ibid.

“我们正在尝试……”：同上。

“We were trying . . .”: Ibid.

“事情已经全部安排好了……”：同上。

“the thing was all laid out . . .”: Ibid.

“有多少家庭主妇……”：Ernest Braun 和 Stuart MacDonald，《微型革命》，第 175 页。

“How many housewives . . .”: Ernest Braun and Stuart MacDonald, Revolution in Miniature, p. 175.

第一款数字手表：《电子学编辑，创新时代》，第 398 页。

the first digital watch: Editors of Electronics, An Age of Innovation, p. 398.

微处理器的故事开始于：Robert Noyce 和 Marcian E. Hoff，《英特尔微处理器发展史》，IEEE Micro， 1981 年 2 月，第 8 页及后续页面；Howard Libes，《美国计算的最初十年》，Byte， 1978 年 7 月，第 64 页及后续页面。

The story of the microprocessor begins: Robert Noyce and Marcian E. Hoff, “A History of Microprocessor Development at Intel,” IEEE Micro, February 1981, p. 8 ff; Howard Libes, “The First Ten Years of American Computing,” Byte, July 1978, p. 64 ff.

“如果这种情况持续下去……”：Noyce 和 Hoff，第 8 页。

“If this continued . . .”: Noyce and Hoff, p. 8.

因此，Busicom 告诉英特尔：同上，第 13 页。

Accordingly, Busicom told Intel: Ibid., p. 13.

“将智能植入许多产品……”：同上。

“insert intelligence into many products . . .”: Ibid.

“片上计算机”：参见1971 年 11 月 15 日《电子新闻》上的广告。

“computer on a chip”: Cf. advertisement in Electronics News, Nov. 15, 1971.

第一项授予微处理器的专利：美国专利号 3,757,306。

the first patent awarded for a microprocessor: U.S. Patent No. 3,757,306.

实际上是一台芯片计算机：美国专利号 4,074,351。

actually was a computer on a chip: U.S. Patent No. 4,074,351.

介绍价格为 200 美元：Libes，第 68 页。

The introductory price was $200: Libes, p. 68.

“计划突破！……”：《大众电子学》， 1975 年 1 月。

“Project Breakthrough! . . .”: Popular Electronics, January 1975.

自制计算机俱乐部：时间， 1983 年 1 月 3 日。

Homebrew Computer Club: Time, Jan. 3, 1983.

“显然，一个有……”的世界：对诺伊斯的采访。

“Clearly, a world with . . .”: Interview with Noyce.

第9 章：DIM-I

Chapter 9: DIM-I

1976 年夏日的一天：《纽约时报》， 1976 年 7 月 11 日，第 3 节，第 13 页；对史密森学会的 Uta Merzbach 博士的采访。

a summer day in 1976: The New York Times, July 11, 1976, sec. 3, p. 13; interview with Dr. Uta Merzbach of the Smithsonian Institution.

销量下降：《纽约时报》， 1982 年 1 月 3 日，第 4 部分，第 9 页。

had watched sales fall: The New York Times, Jan. 3, 1982, sec. 4, p. 9.

“计算器的使用现在是……”：同上，1976 年 7 月 11 日，第 3 节，第 13 页。

“Calculator usage is now . . .”: Ibid., July 11, 1976, sec. 3, p. 13.

“那种无声的计算……”：亨利·佩特罗斯基（Henry Petroski），《关于计算尺的思考》，《技术评论》， 1981 年 2 月/3 月，第 32 页。

“That silent computational . . .”: Henry Petroski, “Reflections on a Slide Rule,” Technology Review, February/March 1981, p. 32.
